Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jimleeds_8
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at Locarno with my wife we were greeted by two lovely members of staff at the reception. We'd had a few complications with our booking made by Hotels.com. This was resolved without even asking. Excellent!! Every member of staff made our stay so good even though we spent so little time in our room or hotel because we spent so much time walking round this lovely city. Our room was small (tiny shower!) but adequate, the bar area was a gem of a place and a nice place to relax. Breakfast was typically Italian and nice (with a bottle of Prosecco to help yoursef to!). Situated close to Piazza del Popolo it was within easy reach to start your walking to the many sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent gateway to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michael S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Locarno during Easter and we had a great time. The atmosphere was splendid. When you just enter the hotel and have a moment to relax at the patio, you immediately feel the Roman vibe. We also liked the gentlemen at the reception desk, very helpful and funny. Locarno is a great hotel to explote Rome, we've walked everything and to give an idea, the Spanish steps is only a few minutes walk. Tip 1: take the limousine service back to the airport (same rate as the reg. taxi's; ask the reception) Tip 2: start your day walking at the nearby Borghese park Tip 3: don't plan to much during the day, go with the Roman flow

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: marianne B
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this Hotel. We had an upgrade from the Annex to the hotel, which was nice. A small spartanic room but ok to the price.The bar atmosphere is the best and the staff are very service minded. The breakfast could be better- not great. Location is the best and just across the street there was the best restaurant in the basement.. Fantastic food to good prices.. We took an express taxi to airport and it was very good..

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: bondoobay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on the top floor in a two-bedroom, two-bath flat complete with spacious sitting room and kitchen. We were traveling with our two children, and this was the perfect room for us. The location is great, and the hotel has art deco charm. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor rooms and value for money”
Reviews.Author: mish7285
Reviews.Content: The location is really perfect - you can explore all major Rome landmarks, by feet within 20 minutes from the hotel. Breakfast buffet is good, however in the early morning on Sunday (7:30am) they didn't have any fresh bakery. Be careful though when going to bar in the evening - we paid 16 eur for 2 colas! Room was quite dark and got really noisy in the evening - you could hear all the noise from the bar patio, until like 1am! I came with my wife and we stayed for 5 nights, but it wasn't easy to get a good sleep, also because the bed was too short and narrow :-( Staff was nice, besides one woman at the reception, who didn't get us the shirt we gane them to iron in time and argued that we didn't ask for a specific time. What is worst, when the shirt actually came, it was far from neatly ironed :-( Italian food in Rome made up for all that :), but next time I'm in Rome, I will stay awa yfrom this hotel - not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Moo-Ray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Locarno for 4 nights in May 2012. We were in the hotel premises across the street. The atmosphere of the hotel was nice - the 1920-ish style fits it well. The outside garden is nice too. Breakfast was good - a nice selection of different types of breakfast foods for all tastes, plus good coffee. The garden bar is popular in the evenings, though it was a shock that a bottle of beer cost 8€! On the other hand that seemed to be the going rate in that neighborhood. We would stay in the Locarno again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, excellent breakfast but...”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious with large windows, the breakfast was exceptional, and the location allowed us to walk to most sights and shopping. The bar is evidenty the hot spot in town in the evenings, which was fun to observe. The charming old fashioned (single) elevator only holds 3 people (less with luggage) so we made the trek up the stairs several times - ok if you are able, but could be a problem if you are not. Overall a really charming hotel, but with a few small drawbacks. The beds were rather hard, and the pillows thin with additional ones unavailable. Rooms in the main building are in need of some renovation (wall coverings). The reception folks were generally very helpful and friendly, but the night clerk on duty when we left at 3:30 a.m. was not - did not speak any English, very flustered and apparently angry that we required attention, actually quite rude. This when we had alerted the staff to the early departure and would have expected him to be expecting us. It was an unfortunte end to an otherwise charming experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but misleading room quality”
Reviews.Author: Robertaccio
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days in this hotel last week. I booked it after looking through the website and reading reviews. When looking at the website, I chose the Standard Double room with "Windows open to view of the city". (highlighted in bold). The picture showed a nice large room. When I got there, I was given a room in the back, windows opened to the side of the backyard, with view over a dilapidated bamboo awning seemingly trying to cover a series of air conditioners. Not what I expected. Aside from that, the tub shower screen wasn't fixed and water was going all over the floor when I showered. I went downstairs and complained, the lady said that I actually got a better deal than what I booked for, and that was an upgrade. No more rooms were available and wouldn't move me. I went back to my room, got my laptop, pulled the reservation, went back down and showed her the picture and the description that I saw when I booked the room. She smiled and said, well, you know about pictures right? They are old and not always representing actuality. As for the view of the city,... she nodded and said, you are right, I'll move you but only tomorrow since nothing else is available. I was annoyed that I had to go through this and fight back. The next day I got a different room. It was better, but know that there is no actual "View of the city" since the building is surrounded by other buildings. GoogleEarth it and you'll know. The top floors might have a better view, but nothing for the first 3 floors. Aside from that, the staff was great, even that lady at the reception turned out to be very kind. My fellow travelers were all happy with their rooms. Breakfast buffet is amazing and service was fantastic. Location is also very good. In general, the hotel offered a nice quaint flair and it was enjoyable. Just know you should put your foot down on getting what you were promised if it doesn't match what you paid for. When in Rome..... :-) Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish getaway”
Reviews.Author: Stainey
Reviews.Content: This charming art deco hotel really hit the spot for my wife and I. Despite the first snowfall in Rome for years the Locarno staff pulled out the stops to provide a hearty welcome from the cold. We stayed in the annex opposite the hotel which felt like staying in a stylish apartment. The old building was full of italian charm and although the room wasn't to the highest of standards the atmosphere of shabby chic more than made up for it. Breakfast was served in the very cool downstairs bar and restaurant which again although a little tired had loads of atmosphere which we loved. The food was great with a hot and cold buffet for breakfast and a basic menu for lunch which I can recommend. The location is in a quiet street close to many attractions and we found it easy to get around on foot, taking in most of the main sights in the three days we were there. Overall, highly recommended if your after a great value romantic getaway with charm and old-school style in bundles.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good location. The staff was very friendly. The room were very clean and bed confortable. The breakfast was ok, with any kind of coffee included in the price. Free bicycles and free access to internet from my room. The room was a little bit small.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: Launcelot77
Reviews.Content: ...book your room at the Hotel Locarno. I stayed at this hotel many times, with or without children, in the large suite under the roof (ideal with 2 childeren) or in a simple double or single room, it was always perfect. The ambience, the decor, the patio and the breakfast bufet, the bar and entrance....everyhing is just charming and nice and as friendly as the staff and reception. It is conveniently located and within walking distance to most of the main attractions and still surprisingly quiet at night. Highly recommended. And should you go there read my upcoming review about this extraordinary restaurant nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Charming central and atmospheric”
Reviews.Author: innercitychic
Reviews.Content: This was booked by my travel agent and I Was a bit apprehensive after reading the reviews on trip advisor! The experience was delightful. We stayed in room 606 which is an upgraded suite. Large, comfortable with windows that open which is great. It is quiet and solo central. Just on piazza del popolo and via corso. Good for shopping and an easy pleasant walk to the trevi, Spanish steps etc. The staff were friendly, funny and universally helpful. Housekeeping did a lovely tidy of the room. People ran bags up stairs - no issue getting us a car to the airport or using the safe. The breakfast is lovely-basic but tasty; nice home made cake, fresh fruit eggs and cereal. The decor is worn but in a homely comfortable bohemian way. If you like modern chic it is not for you. If you want functional, comfortable, central and friendly it is good. Glad I listened to the travel agent :-) I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Pistache1141
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno is a very charming hotel, beautiful old building and friendly staff. The garden bar is very cool (try the cocktails!) and visited by many locals. Location is a strong point, it is ideal for a weekend in Rome, the best starting point for day trips and has many nice restaurants nearby. We loved the bike rental service the hotel offers, try exploring Rome by bike! Breakfast is ok. Now the downsides: It is extremely noisy! I have a very sound sleep but didn’t get any shuteye in the first night. We had a room in the main building towards the street. Unfortunately they are cleaning the streets during the night with noisy machines and we could hear every single noise from the hallway (doors slamming etc) and other rooms. Therefore we asked to change rooms for the second night. The room we got was calmer but not nearly as nice, very old looking and the bathroom stank horribly due to an obvious sewage problem. Conclusions: Mixed feelings. It is such a beautiful location and building, great potential so I think it just needs renovation and a few problems fixed (noise reduction etc). Stay away if you have trouble sleeping and need everything to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Needed..Please Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: oldportnews
Reviews.Content: A travelers first impression of a hotel is usually the reception one receives upon arrival. At the Hotel Locarno Rome the people at the reception desk obviously need lessons on hospitality. Our assigned room was not only tiny, but quite dirty.....in need of paint, the white curtains were a very dark gray , the air conditioning/heating unit, which was attached to the ceiling, had pieces hanging from it and black soot radiating over the ceiling, and let's just say, yes, there was a tiny bathroom. We tried to change rooms for three days and told it was not possible....and told to us with attitude! For many of the rooms, the noise from the hotel bar and courtyard area is not for the timid or for those who want to get some sleep at a reasonable hour. I will say the included full, hot breakfast was a wonderful treat. However, had this been a first trip to Rome, we would not have a favorable impression of all that is Rome....including some of their lovely old world charm hotels. This hotel needs to be avoided until much needed renovations are made and hospitality is returned to the reception desk!

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: judith m
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute highlight of our stay. Our experience in Rome could have been completely different if we had stay close to Termini station let's say... nothing wrong with that location however it's crazy busy and does not stop. Locarno Hotel is on a small, beautiful, quiet street of Rome close to Piazza di Popolo, great location with everything you want and need close to it. Great restaurants, shopping and all the great museums and sightseeing close to you. The staff of the hotel is wonderful, kind, welcoming and useful, they have answers for all your questions. they also have a great bycicle rental service if you dare. their breakfast is at least worth $20 anywhere else, its basic but very well accomplished. The rooms are very nice, however you are in Europe don't expect things to function the way they do in North America, different systems however very efficient and functional. If you ask for a single bed, be prepared they are small. The rooms are cleaned everyday of your stay. We stay at the anexus building (accross the street) which is beautiful and newer. no complains or mayor differences between the two. I would stay there again for sure and reccomended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OllieOreo
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay at the Locarno very much. It's not a luxurious hotel, however it has a lot of charm to it and the location is great! That being said I understand the reviews that say the hotel is in need of restoration! The furniture is rather run down but the atmosphere makes up for it! Also some of the rooms can be rather dark... It has a great location only a few steps from piazza del popolo! There was a little hiccup with the room when we got there. I specifically requested a room with a double bed in it and when we got there, we got a twin bed room... The front disk was a little hesitant to start with because the ment it counted as a double if the beds where pushed together... I had to be quite persistent to get another room which was a bit annoying because I dont want to be an idiot I just want what I had reserved and got confirmed! In the end we got the room we wanted and it all turned out great. I had a lovely stay at Locarno and would have no trouble recommending it to others.. Hotels in Rome is crazy expensive! You pay a lot for the location and not so much the hotel in its own right, this is something I think applies to more or less all hotels in Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but very poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: MariaLisboa2010
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful near the Piazza del Popolo. The problem is the bad condition of the art nouveau building, too old. It really needs urgent restoration. One wall of the rooms we have reserved had plenty of insects and little animals that "attacked" who slept there. Those animals were hidden when we arrived in the morning. But in the middle of the night (3 a.m.), the victim was woken up by their raids and had to go to the reception to move to another room. In fact, one does not expect to have this sort of tropical adventure in Rome, in November... The price is a expensive for the poor quality of the lodging. Obviously THE HOTEL DOES NOT DESERVE THE FOUR STAR RATING. Apart from this, all the rest was quite reasonable, from the service to the breakfast. Thus, I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Safety issue, maintenance issues,poor quality rooms and grumpy service”
Reviews.Author: Leolo1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights. Our first room (which we found out later was a "premium" room) had bad windows which allowed all the street noise into the room and it had a major problem in the bathroom. The toilet wouldn't stop running, and the shower door allowed tons of water to escape onto the bathroom floor, flooding the entire bathroom. We were moved to another room. This room was opened by a skeleton key, but also locked from the inside using this same key. It was very difficult to the lock the room from the inside. I don't know if there are fire codes in Rome, but certainly in an emergency, this tricky lock would be a problem. Both rooms: dark, old, small, uncomfortable. Bathrooms are a joke. All the men on staff were rude and unconcerned. As others have mentioned,yes the courtyard is nice and the location isn't bad, but seriously, this is not a cheap hotel and I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well-placed”
Reviews.Author: SeekingsunMd
Reviews.Content: Near the Plaza Del Popolo and many other attractions, the hotel provided quiet, yet elegant comfort. The staff especially Virgilio was very accommodating, setting up our Vatican tickets and printing them out, having packages delivered to our room and providing a marvelous breakfast each day with great coffee. Terrace roof sitting area where they have occasional entertainment, a good cocktail lounge, but lacks the less expensive brands for the more expensive. E.G. Blue Label Johnny Walker rather than red or black at 32 Euros a glass. They do serve great appetizers for free and other fare at a reasonable price. Great mattress, pillows, housekeeping. We stayed 6 days and didn't believe we could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Some great things, one truly awful thing, know the tradeoffs”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 full weeks at Hotel Locarno, and here are the reasons we didn't leave the hotel after the disasterous first night: First, the ground-level courtyard formed by the two main buildings is truly delightful. You begin your day there with breakfast (included). After a day exploring the city, rest up and start your evening with a cocktail and snacks sitting on a plush chair or comfortable padded bench. The courtard is open to the street through a gate and is accessible to the public, so a large percentage of the patrons are residents beginning their evenings out too. At the end of the evening you can return again to the courtyard for a grappa or other digestif along with other well-dressed Romans doing the same. Also, many other amenities of the hotel are also included. Along with the breakfast there is free wireless internet throughout, and the hotel also provides bicycles which can be used for rides along the Tiber or in the park of nearby Villa Borgese. These turn out to be services uncommon in other Rome hotels (more on this later). Now the awful thing - On the first night we arrived (Saturday), after being awake for some 30 hours, we were given the only ground-floor room in the hotel. This room has a window that is right on the courtyard, _and_ a door onto a landing that is in turn open to the courtyard and is the passageway for the entire building. This might be the worst-placed hotel room I've ever stayed in, and should never have been anything other than storage, let alone classifed "deluxe". Certainly the 50 people chattering away in the courtyard 2 meters from your bed or dragging their luggage over the stairs directly in front of your door assume so. And did I mention there is a sound-system playing music too? We were promised a room change for the following day but immediately started researching other hotels just in case that didn't materialize. The room change was delivered so we didn't evacuate immediately, but we still began to investigate switching to another hotel for the second week of our stay because we were willing to spend more for a more comfortable room. As many other reviews have said, the rooms are frumpy, mostly dark, and the beds are quite mediocre. Bathrooms are by no means fancy but adequate. Our shower/tub had two draining modes: Slow, and slightly less slow. And here's the surprising thing - After visiting half-a-dozen other hotels we decided to stay with the Locarno for the full two weeks. We concluded that the amenities and character were too hard to replace, even though we were willing to pay 100 EUR more a night. Any alternatives would have meant sacrificing that courtyard and being surrounded by hotel guests exclusively rather than integrating with the neighborhood. Not to mention that most hotels charged for internet and breakfast too. So understand the tradeoffs and make sure you don't get room 501. With that in mind you should have a great visit to Rome using the Locarno as your home base.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: jonisue
Reviews.Content: After extensive searching for the "perfect" Rome accomodations, we were greatly disappointed with our results at the Locarno. Coming from a quaint and lovely hotel in Sorrento that was half the price, the Locarno had much to be desired. Pluses--location was convienent to many of Rome's attractions. Ambiance of lobby and bar, dining room and courtyard was attractive. Breakfast buffet was good and had a nice variety. Air conditioning worked. Minuses--MANY! Although we knew ahead of time our room was in the annex, we really felt like stepsisters! No reception desk or any staff located in annex. Room was dusty and bed linens old. View out window was thru bars and to a rusty wall and alleyway. The wireless internet in our room that we payed for never worked the whole time we were there. After I complained repeatedely, they sent someone over who told us the line must be broken and assured us they were working on it and it would be up the next day. LIE!! Talked to other guests who said that their internet never worked either their whole stay. When I asked to be moved to a room that had working internet, they said it wasn't possible. The room had a large step down that was unmarked and to which I didn't remember was there when I went to the bathroom in the middle of the night in the dark. I fell and nearly hit my head against the tub. Thankfully, I wasn't seriously hurt. One of the most disturbing things we encountered during our stay was the disposition of the staff throughout the hotel. With the exception of one female desk clerk and one female bartender, everyone we encountered looked unfriendly, unapproachable and were unwilling to help when we asked any sort of question. The male front desk clerk was so unfriendly and rude every day, it is incredible that he still is employed. The wait staff had to be prompted to wait on people. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel, keep looking. Seriously! There has to be a better hotel out there for the price--this is not a cheap hotel and for the deficiencies it is not worth it. I am always hesitant to believe everything that people write on these review sites but this was two friends trip of a lifetime and this hotel was the only downside of a otherwise fabulous trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Locarno!”
Reviews.Author: JamFan24
Reviews.Content: Perfect location as far as I'm concerned. Love this part of Rome. Locarno is steps from Piazza del Popolo. Really enjoyed the outdoor and indoor bars at night and the roof deck during the late afternoon/early evening. Staff were friendly and accommodating. When I first checked in, the room they gave me was sort of dark and dingy, certainly one of the rooms in need of an upgrade. I asked them if they could do any better, maybe find a brighter, fresher room, considering I was staying 6 days, and they did! No drama. Rooms were clean, breakfast was just fine the two days I partook. They had hot (eggs, sausage) and cold. So, I would say if you like new and pristine, the Locarno's not for you, but if you appreciate faded glamour and charm, great location, interesting guests...stay at the Locarno. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Locarno for one night after our reservation was not honored at the Hotel River Palace. The hotel was dirty and shabby, with severe need of a major remodel. The bathroom had cracked tile in the shower with very obvious mold stain and the shower curtain was dirty, dragging in the water and allowing water to leak all over the floor. We only stayed because we arrived too late to look for another hotel and we were flying home in the early morning. This hotel gets 2-21/2 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: TimKateFred
Reviews.Content: Great location - stylish, no sales reps here, just mysterious couples looking elegent in the hart of this fab city. When ever I visit Rome this will be my base and I have no hesitation in recomending

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable place to stay if you're coming for sight seeing...we would come back!”
Reviews.Author: Yeniper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a 4 night stay. I chose this hotel because I was able to find a good last minute deal and having experience with Italian hotels its 4 star status would at least be a 2-3 star in other countries. Arrival & Location: The check in was friendly and efficient and the location is wonderful. Its right near the piazza del popolo and it's a bit away from the hustle and bustle of the main streets. We felt that the area was safe and we were able to walk to any tourist attraction from here. The room: At first we were disappointed to find out that we were in the building across since the rooms on the website are clearly from the main building. The room we had was not very modern and a bit dark but it was clean and comfortable, we had everything we needed including air conditioning. The bathroom could use some work, the shower/bath was leaky and the tiles were old and didn't feel that clean even if they were. Dining: The breakfast on the terrace is a wonderful way to start the morning and the selection at the buffet was perfect (croissants, eggs, cake, bacon, several types of juice, cold cuts, cheese, fruit, fruit salad & yogurt). We didn't have dinner here but did have a quick lunch one day and a light snack with cocktails on another. There are better places in Rome to have lunch/dinner and I wouldn't recommend having a full meal here but the starters and cold dishes are a nice addition to afternoon cocktails before going out for a real dinner. Other: We were able to get wireless everywhere in the hotel including in our room in the building across the street… those who couldn't connect, the name of the network was different but if you ask the front desk they can help. Summary: It's a nice place to stay if you are not going to spend your days at your hotel. Don't expect a 4 star room… the room is perfect for people who would like a clean, safe and decently priced place to sleep, wake up, have a nice breakfast and head out to discover Rome then come back for a cocktail, quick shower and back out for night time discovery! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayne Z
Reviews.Content: I, with my wife and daughter, took a vacation in Italy. The first three days in Rome were hellish and miserable because of the broken air condioning in late August at the Hotel Lacarno Rome. There was a window fan that was loud and obnoxious. This was a part of a travel package that I got through AAA. Never again. Bad hotel

Reviews.Title: “was shown pictures of Locarno, but got room in Annex building across street !”
Reviews.Author: shawnsk
Reviews.Content: first of all, i felt duped by unnamed but very famous online reservation site. didn't know i was getting a room in a different older building with no wireless internet and no reception desk. reception desk was very rude when i expressed my dismay. i can't comment on rooms at the actual locarno, just make sure yours doesn't say "annex". our room was large by european standards, but very dated. bath tiles were very old. bed was comfortable. wall mount A/C was good. i had to struggle 20 min to open window shutter with broken handle to let some light in. included breakfast was at locarno. mediocre at best. small. okay if you stay 1 or 2 nights. after that you run out of choices. wireless works only within a few feet of the router in the breakfast area. not even in the lobby. definitely not across the street in annex. probably not in locarno rooms. location is at the far north end of the tourist attractions near piazza del popolo. not a bad place, but a good 45-60 min walk to Colosseum at the south end. a better mid-point is near the Trevi fountain. arranged car transport back to airport through hotel for 45 euros 2 people with bags. taxi charges per bag.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: babcu
Reviews.Content: The one good thing I can say about the hotel is that it is in a quiet location. The breakfast room is outdoors and peaceful, except for the birds who look for crumbs. Our room was not so pleasant. It was dark and small. We had already switched from an even smaller, darker room. The bathroom had mold around the toilet and shower. Our two adult kids had another room, which was brighter and had a mold-free bathroom. We asked for an upgrade and was told the price but it would have only been available after we had already left. The hotel had been highly recommended by an associate who called it lovely and quaint. I would disagree wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nymasriya
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late. We stayed there in end April beginning of May 2011. We were 5 ladies from NY, in Rome for 5 days. Check in- A++ Checking in was smooth sailing and the front desk staff was welcoming and friendly. Rooms- B- So most European rooms are quite small, and this one held to those standard. Our room was on the second floor just ablove the garden- so it got pretty loud at night. The room was quite warm so we needed to open the window, but then couldn't sleep because of the noise. So it was a double edge sword. The rooms were clean. Location- A++++ we were close to everything. We walked the streets of Rome and always found our way home! Breakfast- C The variety of the breakfast buffet left much to be desired. And by the 5 th day we could barely deal with eating the same thing again. However the cappuccino was AMAZING! The one downfall was the elevator. It could only fit about 3 people at a time and If you had luggage, you are lucky to fit yourself in. After walking the streets of Rome all day, the last thing you want to do it trek up stairs. All in all I loved this hotel. The front staff was so helpful , cheerful and friendly. The roof top garden is a great place to sit and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “art deco charming”
Reviews.Author: shelley13toronto
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Piazza de Popolo, breakfast in the garden, art deco bar, simple rooms with high ceilings, excellent staff, roof terrace, block to river. No tour buses or tour groups or crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- rooms are just ok”
Reviews.Author: devon247
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing- right by the Piazza del Popolo. The bar/courtyard is really charming. The rooms in the main building are small and old. There was no AC-- so they were hot and stuffy. We switched to the second building after one night. The room was much bigger, brighter and had AC. Overall it was really expensive for what it was. I would rather spend a little bit more and stay at a 5 star luxury hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monty249
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and it was perfect! the staff was friendly and attentive. The room was perfect but it was a bit difficult to take a shower in a bath tub and the whole bathroom got flooded. Otherwise, the hotel's location was perfect. We walked a lot, which was difficult due to to the excruciating heat but the room had a good working air-conditioning. The breakfast was very good. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. After a long day of sightseeing, we sat at the patio and enjoyed a nice Italian wine.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend hotel”
Reviews.Author: needtotravel12345
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel was one of the most expensive and highest rated (4 star) hotels we stayed in on our 10 day trip to Spain / Italy, it was by far our worst experience. Low-lights include bathroom smelled awfully of sewage, air conditioning did not work, mattress felt like a trampoline, and overall ambiance of room was bad (lime green walls with dim florescent lighting and very odd "antique" furniture). Also room was on first floor with view of side street any many loud trucks late night and early morning. i will say the hotel staff was very helpful and apologetic about our stay (especially the sewage smell which apparently is not common), but as they were fully booked we were not able to change rooms. they offered a discount to stay another night in the hotel when we returned to rome, but we decided even a discounted room was not worth it for the poor night's sleep we got there. we found many other 3 star and apartments / bed & breakfast establishments to be far superior in both quality and certainly in value. would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,best location and service.”
Reviews.Author: livlife01
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to many sites and restaurents. Walk to trevi fountain, spainish steps, the duomo and staff sensational. Highly recommended. Room small but comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Better than first impression”
Reviews.Author: LindaM82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and her two teen daughters for a quick 4-day stay in Rome. Upon checking in to our room, my first reaction was that this seemed more a 3-star hotel (rather than 4) and we either needed to have our room upgraded or find another hotel. The bed mattresses looked flimsy,and the room was dark with poor lighting. However, upon decided to give it a day's try, we started to warm up to the place. The bed was more comfortable than it looked, the shower was terrific, the big windows let in sufficient light (once we opened the curtains). But the best features of all was the hotel's bar - a little haven amidst chaotic Rome and the hotel's location. The euphemisms we originally used to describe the hotel - "authentic" and "charming" actually turned out to be true, once we took off our typical hotel lenses and opened ourselves to the "experience."

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lovingcoupleHamburg
Reviews.Content: We had a family reuinon because of my Mum's 80th birthday. My three sisters and me enjoyed the hotel together with my Mum. We loved the terrace on top and had a wonderful lunchbreak there and a good - night drink, too. The best was the light and airy rooms: wooden floors!!! and the shady breakfast terrace, not to forget the brilliant location and very helpful staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Eorchant
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be overpriced and lacking in basic amenities. Our room was supposed to be air conditioned but it was not working for the duration of our stay. . The front desk employees could not have been less helpful. The room itself was dingy. The paint in the bathroom was peeling. The bed was spectacularly uncomfortable. Although I was sad to leave Rome, I was happy to be departing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pisan49
Reviews.Content: It was my 4th time it rome and my wife's 1st. Our stay at the Locarno was fantastic. The staff was very helpful, the room was a nice size and the breakfast buffet was very good. We were in walking distace to many attractions including a 30 min. walk to St. Peters. Very close to Flaminio and Spagna metro stations. There are a lot of very good small restraunts in the area. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Britta_BG
Reviews.Content: This is a most avarage hotel. Hard beds, lousy breakfast, a shower that made a terrible noise, no place to put the soap and shampo in the shower cabin. You wont get anything of a hotel experience, just sleep. And you can get that a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with authentic decor!”
Reviews.Author: Raj86_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and didnt really know what to expect with all the mixed reviews however I have to say we really enjoyed our week long stay at Hotel Locarno! We were really well situated and managed to walk everywhere which was great, the hotel was clean and tidy hotel withstaff were very helpful. Our room was a standard room and was exactly wanted we expected however I advise anyone staying here in the future to pack a travel iron as the hotel does not provide a iron due to a fire a few years ago. Our booking included breakfast but there was not a great deal of choice which was a shame so we had to make do with croissants which did get boring after 7 days on the trot! The hotel is 4 star rated which is something I would argue as I have stayed in a number of 4 star hotels and this was not of the same standard. The decor was very rustic Italy which I really liked and gave the hotel a great character. The bar and outside seating area were lovely and we loved sitting out there in th evening and having a few drinks with our meal. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and if we were to return we would definitely be staying again and anyone going to Rome I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by the pictures”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandMo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Locarno over Easter. I would not go back. Our room was so small, you couldn't swing a cat if you tried. The decor was tired and the bathroom looked shabby to a point where I didn't want to use the facilities. Service: one word: Terrible. We had a leaking toilet in our room, a case of the cisterne constantly running. Usually an easy thing to fix. Would've done it myself but it was one of those hidden in the walls so I had no access. Repeated requests to the front desk with assurances of prompt repair turned out to be false promises. I slept very badly throughout our 4 night stay. Atrocious service by the hotel staff continued in the dining room. Waiters are practically running AWAY from you as to avoid having to take your orders. I could go on but I think the message is clear. Avoid and don't be fooled by the pictures or special offers you may find. There are better places to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: farmersarah
Reviews.Content: This hotel prides itself on having been a 20s hotspot, and I believe it was glamorous then, but it is pretty run down now. The birdcage elevator is cool, but I think it ends there. The first room I was put into was barely big enough for the bed and the bathroom barely big enough for the toilet- there was a fold-out bedet under the sink. I had requested and confirmed via email a non-smoking room but it was clear that not only had this room been a smoking room (the smell and ashtray were dead giveaways) but there was a also a smell of sewage in the room; I slept terribly the first night. The next morning I requested to be moved rooms, and to the credit of the staff they were very accommodating and even moved my luggage for me during the day while I was out exploring the city. The new room was quite a bit larger and didn't smell, but it did not seem very clean- there were bog dust bunnies in the corners and the shower curtain in the tiny shower looked moldy. I can't imagine they clean the black velvet bedspreads very often because they are so big and heavy. The breakfast was alright, they had a decent variety. The location was quite good, within walking distance of everything (anyone who tells you Rome isn't walkable is lying, I walked everywhere with not problem, including to the Vatican). However the location alone can't make up for the fact that it was extremely expensive to stay here and was not nearly the comfortable experience I was expecting treating myself to what I had read in guidebooks to be a somewhat fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great character”
Reviews.Author: JenBam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful art nouveau style hotel. Shabby but with fantastic character. Bar full of trendy Italians in the evening-not the cheapest bar but Rome is definitely not cheap. Service in the hotel was polite but never with a smile! The service was tested when our over zealous safe decided to keep our passports.. Several attempts to re-set the password failed resulting in an angle grinder being deployed! Showers of sparks, andlots of Italian swear words later - our valuables emerged unscathed! Overall a memorable and enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with +'s & -'s”
Reviews.Author: MisterSR
Reviews.Content: We booked Locarno as we found an amazing rate and the hotel came fairly decently recommended. After paying 3-4 times more than what we paid for this room I honestly thought it was a decent value and would stay again without hesitating. Our room was far from luxurious but again the value was exceptional. We were given a room in the annex across the street but were quite pleased when we discovered that our room included a quaint patio. Unfortunately the A/C was not working as it is still supposed to be the cool season but I would prefer that the decision of whether to run it or not be left up to me. Someone next door also ran the bath from 4am-7am and I could not sleep at all. However, for the bargain basement price I cannot complain. The bar was very nice and the outdoor patio was apparently the place to be on Sunday evening. The rooftop terrace is also pretty nice and the location is to die for in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tired rooms and poor service”
Reviews.Author: wisewo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights at the start of our trip. We arrived early (10:00am) and hoped to get our room a bit early and they told us we would have our room by noon but we ended up getting it around 2:30pm. I had read the reviews and specifically paid for a better room so we wouldn't end up across the street (where I have read that the rooms were not very nice) but they put us across the street in a very basic, small, dark room and then were told that we would have to move the next day to a different room in the same building. I complained and was told they were full and that they would try to do something the next day. The next day we were moved to a room in the main hotel and it was fine but tired with springs digging in our back, old torn blankets and a dripping shower - and this was better then our first room. My husband also had a medical issue and asked about seeing a doctor and told us it would take 2-3 hours and to just find the pharmacy instead. The patio is very nice and location good but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hope to go again”
Reviews.Author: karenms1960
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, Angelica on the desk was very helpful and spoke excellent English. The map we were given was very clear. . It is in an excellant location for all the sights. We used the Metro which was easy and only 1 Euro a journey. We booked our trips through Viatour, brilliant guides. Use the hotel transport to get back to the airport it costs 50 Euros which was cheaper than the taxi we got from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and helpful staff, but be aware of hidden charges when booking!”
Reviews.Author: rettep
Reviews.Content: We booked a special offer at this hotel, or at least we thought we did until we recieved the confirmation e-mail which said that they would charge us about 100€ more than the special offer on the website said it would cost us. When we complained about this they said that the offer was not valid when we made our booking, and that they had created that offer a few days after made our reservation. Very strange since we would not have made a reservation at Locarno at the price we were charged. Oh well, when we got there they upgraded us to a better and bigger room and the staff were very nice and had answers to all our questions. The hotel is very beautiful but a bit runned-down. Kind of pricy and the breakfast is not very good... Close to the Spanish steps, piazza del popolo, fontana di trevi and the pantheon. A very nice rooftop terrace with a great view over the city! If they wouldn't have charged extra from what the website said I would have said that this is a very nice and affordable hotel, but now I'll do with just saying that this is a beautiful hotel but that you could probably find something better for the money you pay here...

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a first time visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kheaton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Locarno for our 5 year anniversary in early Feb. We're not people who are bothered about lots of facilities or a/c, but prefer characterful hotels in nice areas. The hotel is in a great location for a first time visit to Rome, just off one of the main shopping streets and within walking distance of mot sights. Check in was easy. Our room, no. 503, was through a lovely covered courtyard on the ground floor. It was fairly small, but adequate. Nice 20s decor. For some reason the room was incredibly hot - we couldn't find a control for the temperature so lived with it. The room was on the street, so there was a little noise, but nothing too disturbing, especially as it's not a very busy street. The main building had a lovely caged lift and a nice roof terrace. Breakfast was fine: pastries, cakes, fresh fruit, cereal, some hot dishes (i'm not sure what they were - looked like mashed potato and beans?!). The bar/breakfast room was lovely. At night it turns into a really buzzing bar - even if you're staying in the hotel make sure you reserve a table for drinks! All in all I'd stay there again, although would maybe ask for a room in the main building. If you don't stay there certainly go for drinks one night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Traditional Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marymoney
Reviews.Content: So many hotels in Italy are going contemporary. The Locarno really exudes the flavor of this majestic, historical city. It is older, but so charming. It will make your stay in Rome more of a 24 hour experience. I will return to the Locarno. Wonderful hotel in an excellent location. My room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “In spite of daily requests they never honored the booking for 2 beds to accommodate my colleague and I.”
Reviews.Author: b25b25
Reviews.Content: We were put across the street from the main hotel in the Depandance Anahi. Desk staff were totally unresponsive to requests for a room that matched what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Everything covered in mold.”
Reviews.Author: mommapokes
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the street, with heavy loud road noise. Mold growing out of air vent. Grout in bathroom so covered in mold, it looked like white tile with black brown fuzzy grout. We stayed 3 days & a wet towel stayed on the shower shelf the whole time. Will never spend 200 euro on a room like this again.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlotte34Midlands
Reviews.Content: I was so worried when reading the reviews on here about the Hotel, and the terrible ones could not be more wrong. The hotel is charming with all the features you could want. Our hotel room 223 i the Annex was perfect for us to rest our heads after long days walking to all the sites, the bed was comfy and we did not wake up till 9am - 9.30am most mornings due the dark and quiet room. The bathroom was lovely and our towels got changed daily. Any one moans about the tiredness of the hotel should really understand this is Rome so if you want a modern Holiday Inn go to the US where nothing is more than 10 years old!!!! The breakfast was amazing. we had choice of bacon, eggs, tomatos, pastries, lovely juice and coffee even champayne for your Mimosa, a reat start to the day and we did not have to eat again till about 3pm. The hotel is in an excellent location so close to all the sites and we managed to walk to all of them with no problem. The staff behind the desk were really helpful and gave us a great map to use around the city. The drinks in the bar (vodka and coke 16 euro's) were very pricey so we just stayed away. Rome is expensive but worth it. The price we paid around the £475 mark for four nights was good value. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel breakfast buffet was great!”
Reviews.Author: BettyLou_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful with directions & pleasant in every way. Hotel was a little tired, but enjoyed the age & atmosphere of it all. Great location. Walked to most attractions. Close to Metro. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with friendly staff and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: KMurnahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Locarno as part of our honeymoon, which we mentioned to the front desk when we checked in...we had to wait a bit for our room to be ready, but it was so worth the wait. Our room was on the very top floor of the annex and it was more like an apartment than a room. It was huge, clean and super nice! Plus we had our own private rooftop patio which was perfect for drinking wine in the evenings. The hotel staff was very friendly, one of the ladies at the front desk recommended going to Pienza in Tuscany and even gave us a book that she had written about Pienza as a gift! And it was a great recommendation. The hotel also left a complementary bottle of champagne in our room when we checked in, which was a nice touch. The hotel itself is very eclectic and charming. It's in a great location that's pretty much walkable to/from anywhere in the city. Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps are very close by. The hotel also has an outdoor courtyard as well as a rooftop terrace for drinking and dining, both of which are relaxing with a great atmosphere. The hotel was a bit pricey, but everything in Rome is pricey, so for the location and the friendly staff, it was definitely worth it. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Has its good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: HMTLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location, nice garden for drinks and food, good breakfast and nice balcony views. Bad points: The garden turns into a very noisy night spot between 7pm and 11pm. The staff was helpful but stand-offish, which made us feel as if we were bothering them. The cost was a bit high for the value received.

Reviews.Title: “Look some where else if you want hospitable service”
Reviews.Author: melody1068
Reviews.Content: Where should I start? As soon as I entered the lobby I was not even greeted with a smile. The woman was rude. The hotel itself needs renovations asap. I understand that I am in the historic city but is it necessary to stay in a hotel that lacks amenities. My room was okay. I felt I was ripped off. I know I will never stay here again even if its free, no thank you. Look somewhere else, not the Locarno.

Reviews.Title: “We do not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ELIZA1978
Reviews.Content: We were waiting something more from this hotel.Good location.Very old hotel,not renovated.Lack of hot water.Poor breakfast.Unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel that needs an IT consultant.”
Reviews.Author: iloveitaly2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, not too far from the subway and close to Piazza del Popola. The staff were reasonably friendly and helpful. My room was small, but comfortable and had working A/C. Really my only complaint is that their customer computer didn't work while I was there and they didn't seem to care, much less fix it. For me, this was an important issue because I did not have my laptop, was traveling alone and trying to make trip plans as I traveled. I really needed a functioning computer. If you are interested in this hotel, I suggest that you book online because it is cheaper than the phone reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Main building ok, annex very bad”
Reviews.Author: floridian33311
Reviews.Content: i was stuck in the annex across the street. Internet service promised but not available. View of brick wall and dirty air space. Dead flowers in window. Ugly wall paper, cheap furniture, no antiques. Front desk service bad. Unmarked dangerous step in middle of room. AC did not work. Room service very limited and no info in room on any services. Overpriced for this room.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sadaka2006
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, very European....great people........as we were preparing to leave and visit the Amalfi Coast the manager took much of his time to recommend Sorrento over our first choice (we thank him for that) and directed us to train transportation

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with 1920s vibe”
Reviews.Author: criticdesandiego
Reviews.Content: This little hotel in the heart of Rome is right near the Piazza de Popolo and the parks of the Borghese - very well located a short walk from all the designer shops, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and more. Our rooms were very spacious and the bathroom was enormous (although with all that room we felt they could have fit a shower AND a bathtub - I never get used to those baths with the spray thing that gets water all over the place). The hotel was built in the 1920s and maintains much of its original charm from that era. The bar and restaurant are chic and charming- we felt like we were in a speakeasy hideaway. One of the cool things about Hotel Locarno is the open courtyard, where they serve breakfast in the mornings and cocktails in the evening. After a long day of slogging through the cobbled streets to tour the sights, it was nice to sit down in comfy armchairs in the open air and sip a compari and soda. There were people and languages from all over the world, and it was very cool for us and our kids to be part of it all. The staff was so accommodating and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable - and they really helped the kids feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Frozen in Time (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: oldfloridafan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who thought I would appreciate the art deco decor of the Locarno, and I was not disappointed. I was a bit concerned due to several of this site's recent reviews, but as I was only staying for two nights I decided to give it a try. My experience: 1. Yes, the furnishings in the main building are dated. They were all art deco, so I would have been disappointed if they were newer. The floor of our room was made of a beautiful herringbone pattern. Our wallpaper was fabric, a nice touch. 2. One smallish TV in the corner of the room. We never turned it on (a bit pointless when on vacation in Rome, in this person's opinion). 3. We had both thin towels (my preferred type) and very thick towels (my husband's preferred type) in the bathroom. Our bathroom was very clean. A few chipped tiles, but no trouble with that. The shower was a bit small, but suitable. 4. We stayed in a standard double on the third floor of the main building. The room was quite roomy for Europe and the windows kept all noise out from he street. We heard no noise from other rooms, although we did see guests entering the rooms next to us. 5. The staff was friendly and helpful. I do not speak much Italian, but I made an effort, which seemed to make the staff more eager to help. Service in the bar is typical of what I experienced in Rome, in that you need to get the attention of the staff to place an order. This is also how the locals in the bar ordered. 6. Breakfast was very good, with excellent espresso drinks made to order along with ample bread and fruit offerings. The bartenders make excellent and creative cocktails. After a long day of sightseeing, the bar are provided a terrific setting to unwind. 7. An earlier review spoke of an elevator. I've included a picture of the absolutely charming cage-type elevator. The stairs that wrapped around the elevator are wide and carpeted. The elevator was slow, but worked just fine. Our stay was very enjoyable and we slept soundly. The location was excellent and the staff very helpful. I plan to stay again in the future. Very charming and an excellent value. (I booked through the hotel website and received a discount for booking in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel IF they actually had air conditioning and internet.”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl4
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the pros. This hotel was in a fantastic location with a great restaurant across the street and to the right. We ate there 2 nights, it was so good. It was very quaint, and the staff was fantastic. The breakfast wasn't bad, and the option of eating out on the terrance was nice, except for the pigeons. In the evening, the terrance was a great place to relax and have drinks. It is close to all the sites of Rome, as well as great shopping. Over all the hotel wasn't bad for the price. Now for the cons. The air conditioning didn't work at all and the internet was non existant. And we were there for 5 nights. When we arrived, we were shown 3 different rooms, 2 of which were supposed to have air conditioning. The air never worked the entire time we were there. I wound up with a horrible heat rash that lasted for 3 days, and had I not paid for the hotel in full before arriving, I might have looked for another hotel, just for air conditioning. Unfortunately, the internet didn't work at all while we were there either. I could have lived with the internet, but the lack of air, not so much We were there during a heat wave, and really didn't a good night's rest the entire time we were there. I would recommend this hotel, but only if you were staying there in the fall, winter, or early spring. Never in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms and a "scene" in the bar”
Reviews.Author: SwitzerNYC
Reviews.Content: Wow..I don't remember the rooms being this tiny. I was traveling with a friend so needed twin beds and we asked to be upgraded as the room was so small. A superior room wasn't much better so we ended up in a junior suite. Biggest problem was that the room never cooled down and my friend slept on a day bed in the "living" room, but no TV there. Only one was in the bedroom. It was just not the value that I remember from 10 years ago. I think there is a newer tower on the other side of the courtyard. Maybe those rooms are nicer. John Malkovich was having breakfast one morning so something must be good there. Staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel out of design book”
Reviews.Author: AnjaBukina
Reviews.Content: I was intrigued by Hotel Locarno, reading about it in Design hotels book ( 2001) and stayed there for 2 days/1 night. It’s very centrally located, easy to find, yet out of main tourist traffic and on a quiet street – very close to shopping area and Spagna. Design truly sticks to 20es with Art Deco items and antique furniture carefully chosen to create the hotel’s unique style. The restaurant/bar patio is absolutely charming, hidden from the day heat and so romantic in the evening. As for some guests here in reviews mention noise – well, this bar seems like a popular hangout with the locals coming out for a drink, so evenings should be expected to be lively. It’s a good place to do some people watching if you’re interested, it has many locals turning up for dinner or breakfast, all dressed up and very Roman types. I would like to thank the hotel staff who were helpful and polite – and speaking several languages, especially Mr. Yannick for being really friendly and attentive. Generally, from the 20es nature of the hotel a visitor should expect some old antique items and furniture, so if you are not a fan of old things you might be a bit disappointed with rooms, that need a refurb. However, it all pays up by a gracious atmosphere and sophisticated style of essenza di Roma: the more ageing, the more elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.....”
Reviews.Author: redvlpr
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed. Noisy area. Not particularly friendly staff. Poor decor, lousy elevator, not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: amycakes86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Locarno recently and were pleased with our experience. The rooms were clean with high ceilings and quaint shutters on the windows. Those who complain about the noise level must have been staying in the bar, because i'm a light sleeper and did not experience any noise disruption despite being in a 1st floor room directly next to the stairwell and lift, and in close proximity to the bar and reception. The road was noisy, but simply closing the window blocked this out. The bar also seemed to be empty by about 11:30-midnight. The bathroom was tiny, but unless you're planning on spending your holiday in it, its not a problem. Service wise, we only found one member of staff who spoke fluent English. This was a bit frustrating as our Italian is terrible, but when in Italy what do you expect? The language barrier did not stop us from getting what we wanted once we'd worked out how to say our room number and order coffee. The service was more abrupt than what we have grown to expect in the UK/USA, but that is not exclusive to the hotel. We found that service across Rome (especially when you are a couple in their mid-twenties) can be rather negligent and prickly at best. The Romans tend to give better service to those over 30 and especially when they can smell the euros! The location of the hotel was perfect as it was easy to walk everywhere. The Piazza Del Poppolo is a beautiful stop for people watching and really only a stone's throw away, as is the Villa Borghese. Only 20 mins to the Vatican (go on a weds morning for the papal address at about 10:30 - its free and a different experience), 20 mins to the Trevi fountain, 10 mins to the Spanish Steps and Pantheon and about 40 mins to the Colosseum. Don't bother with a bus tour. Save your money and do it on foot. Dinner is an all evening event in Rome, so don't mistake slow waiters for bad service. That's just how the Romans do it. Try one of the little Osterias or Trattorias in the side streets near the Spanish steps, as many of them are quite quaint and cosy. Splash out on a Ristorante if you're feeling flush. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Locarno and have recommended it to my parents who want to visit the city. Our tip is just to relax, forget what you think you know about customer service and just enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Average Hotel, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: flubberdubdub
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wasn't suprised when we arrived and were shipped off to another hotel with no apology or compensation because it was overbooked. The hotel wasn't anything special even though they had said they had booked us into a five star luxury hotel. When we arrived back, the hotel did nothing to compensate us. The rest of our stay was average, the hotel is in an ideal location and we walked everywhere. However it is three star standard not four. The rooms need updating and so does the rest of the hotel. The breakfast was average. If you decide to go for this hotel, do not book directly with them. You can get a cheaper deal through a travel agent and then you won't feel so stung when you realise what a disappointment it it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Caropa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, with lovely rooms. The bed was the hardest we'd had throughout our 2 week trip, but it wasnt awful. The room was also quite noisy being near the elevator where you could hear all the way from top to bottom all 6 floors of noise. The room was cozy though, with lovely windows and lots of space. Bathroom was clean, although shower did not drain. Good location, walked to everything. Breakfast was delicious and a great spread, included in cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Longton1
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I had used Expedia to research it/book it and the pictures shown and the positive reviews were, in my opinion, highly inaccurate. The room I got (for over $300/nite) was tiny and smelled like a backed up sewer . My family members had similar issues with their rooms. The desk staff is not friendly, not helpful, and apparently "numb" to complaints. I learned there are 2 sides to the hotel , and that the "rooms" shown on the websites are from the good side ($500+/nite) This is a great location (close to Piazza del Poppolo) and the nightclub here (The Scene) must be one of Romes new top hot spots , but I would not reccomend this place to anyone seeking comfort or value.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: VisitortoRomeVisitor
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent: although very close to busy Via di Ripetta, the hotel is on a relatively quiet street and is an excellent base for sightseeing. I had a very pleasant stay: the staff were professional, friendly and helpful. My bedroom was attractively decorated, quiet at night and very clean. The ample breakfast is served in the attractive Art Deco bar which at night is frequented by stylish young Italians - so people watching is an added attraction! There is a rooftop garden from which there is a view westwards towards St Peter's Basilica and where it is very pleasant to sit above the city in the morning or evening. I stayed at the hotel in April when the wisteria at the front of the building was in bloom which was such a pretty sight. I will certainly consider staying here on future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bar Drinks”
Reviews.Author: robalex
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno is a great place to go for drinks in the evenings.......well, it used to be! All those tables and all those patrons...well that's a lot of drinks to order....! My friend and I ordered a martini, Beefeater only, followed by two bloody marys. The bloody marys were a-w-f-u-l. My 14-year olds do better than that. No flavour, no taste, just a bit of tabasco. Waiting time is horrible. They bring you stuff to eat but your throat dries out by the time drinks arrive. That bar is just way too small and the barman is too inexperienced, or just too childish to understand how to prepare a proper cocktail, and plainly not enough of them. The waitresses are very efficient at cleaning up, but painfully slow at bringing the booze! What a pity, a great hangout, very trendy, but lousy service and bad bartenders. oh..4 drinks...€56!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise for everyone”
Reviews.Author: OsloNordic
Reviews.Content: Dear Sirs You can't charge this sum for such noisy beds , room floors or stairs... I could hardly sleep or move in my bed for a week without waking up ! I hope Room 615 is the worst - and I suggest you give us a bonus week-end in return. As a Volcano Victim from the Icelandic erruption we even had 3 extra night were you charged us 50 EURO extra - when the rest of the world were giving dicounts to stranded guests ! We did not want to make the stay unpleasant for both of us by complaining - but I think I should tell you now. I f It had not been for the great breakfast and the bikes we would have moved after the first night. I will recomend if you give us a bonus stay in a non noisy room....

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with some excellent staff badly let down by others”
Reviews.Author: snowymilou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the ground floor, the proximity to the bar meant that it was incredibly noisy. It was unclear if a room change was possible as there were three of us. In general the reception, portering and cleaning staff were excellent. The waiting staff notably at breakfast were unhelpful, indeifferent and unpleasant. It reminded me of the sort of service you used to in the eastern bloc in the days of state control. Getting a hot drink was hard but holding onto your plate was harder as the waiters swooped like seagulls to grab it the moment you stopped eating. A sure sign of under occupation. If this hotel has air con it is well hidden and denied by the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and well-sited.”
Reviews.Author: remington700
Reviews.Content: The Locarno is an elegant and comfortable hotel with helpful, friendly staff. It is well-sited near the Piazza Popolo and the Villa Borghese in the north of Rome, with a number of excellent Osterias and other restaurants close by - the Osteria Santa Ana, just across the road was particularly good. My only complaint is that it tends to be quite noisy at night, especially if your room is near the bar. One improvement would be tea and coffee making facilities in the room. But overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “We hope to return before too long!”
Reviews.Author: Soepheli
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno is a lovely place, even if slightly in need of refurbishing which I believe is on the cards. Meanwhile, this seemed to add to its attraction. Really friendly & helpful staff; we travelled in early March with my 85-year-old mother who uses a wheelchair, she was well looked after and LOVED the 1920s atmosphere! There's a beautiful roof garden with spectacular views over the city, and a romantic courtyard that catches the sun, complete with the calming sound of tinkling water from a pretty fountain. A special plus: The very ample & delicious daily buffet breakfast which is available until 11am, for a nice & relaxed start to the day. Also: A truly impressive choice of teas to be enjoyed in the afternoon, and unusual & exotic aperitifs in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but shabby, not chic”
Reviews.Author: justroamingRome
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 4 nights in room 222 in the annexe. The location of the hotel is good but it is tired and faded and in desperate need of a refurb. Although the hotel appears to be tucked away down a side street the noise from the hotel bar and from the passing traffic is excessive and goes on well into the early hours of the morning. Certainly not the hotel to stay at if you like to have any sleep on holiday! Our room was a little dingy and depressing but this could be improved with some brighter lighting and decoration. The bathroom decoration and skirting board needs urgent attention and maintenance and the shower cubicle needs a deep clean. The choice at breakfast is good but the dining room is dark and drab . This hotel desperately needs money spending on it to bring it up to an acceptable standard for 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst experience I have had in a "4* Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: PJ_SuttonColdfield
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of four to Rome for the Six Nations Weekend and stayed 3 nights in the Locarno. When we booked (in Auguts 2009) we booked a 4* hotel. When we arrived we were told initially that as their computer system had gone down they had overbooked and had no rooms for us (we were later told that they had a problem with one of the floors!). We were offered another hotel for one night and then advised we would be moved back to the Locarno (in their sister hotel which was a 3*)- as we had such a short stay this was not acceptable especially as we could have been advised in advance. Eventually they found us two rooms in the Locarno - the twin room was OK but was in need of a refurb. The double room contained a bed which was not even 3/4 size and an even smaller bathroom. We complained to reception and requested that the manager speak to us about it and offer some form of reduction - we never saw the manager! On check out we were advised that he had agreed a €20 per room reduction for the total stay- not a lot when the total cost was €450 - and was not available to discuss it with us. There was however a lovely residents bar - if you could actually get in it! The three nights we were there it was reserved in parts for parties held by non residents and we were moved from one area to another only to be moved again within five minutes by a very rude member of staff. It is a real shame that we had such service at the hotel and teh staff were so unhelpful, as the location was ideal for the centre of Rome and also was only 30 minutes from the rugby ground.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are partly right”
Reviews.Author: martinLondonSW14
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this place. Yes, it's overpriced. Yes, it's a bit faded. Yes, they're probably trading off Hip Hotels listing a decade ago (which is where we saw it). We weren't able to book the same room for 3 nights and got a Standard for 1 night at EUR115 and a Superior for 2 at EUR185. My advice - book a standard. We thought we were in the Standard, and after night 1 duly offered to move rooms, but they had in fact upgraded us. Nice - but frankly the Superior was barely what we expected as Standard! It was big, but quite bare and dated. Americans would probably go beserk! On the other hand.... the lounge was lovely and duals as breakfast room (the breakfast is fab and avoids any need for lunch) and as quite funky bar in the evening (which fills up quite fast). If you order a drink they also bring you a substantial snack selection FREE - the first time we turned it away saying we hadn't ordered any, thinking otherwise we'd get charged for it, but they insisted it was free, and then when we ordered a second drink they brought another plate. Thus you could avoid having to pay for any meals at all - though that would be a bit of a shame in Rome! Roof terrace also looked nice, though not used in Feb, and location (Piazza del Popolo) is great - we walked everywhere. Staff were friendly and helpful in our experience, both at reception and breakfast/bar,

Reviews.Title: “You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: MoonMaid180
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno was recommended to us by a local saying it was historic and well located. Those 2 attributes may be true, but his hotel has a lot of problems. First of all, it is not well maintained, nor is it clean. It photographs well, but when you look at anything up close, you will notice the furniture upholstery is stained and dirty, mirrors covered in a film, panes of glass in windows are coated with a grunge, scummy marble countertops. We stayed in 2 different rooms and both showers barely drained, forcing us to shower in +ankle deep water . Our second room required 4 keys for entry and/or exit and as my husband pointed out, in the event of a fire, many guests would perish because the keys are difficult to operate and confusing. In the US this level of building code violation would cause citation and closure. In my opinion, Hotel Locarno is showing great disrespect to its guests, through lack of maintenance, cleanliness and not really caring about their over-charged guests experience or safety. It has the feel of miserly ownership riding on the coat tails of a bygone reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hvilsted
Reviews.Content: This hotel capitalizes on the Hip Hotel description it once got. I don't know if it was true then, but it is absolutely not the case now. The rooms are 1-star quality and in very bad shape with maintenance completely absent for years. We first had a room with a howling ventilation system which couldn't be turned off. Then we moved to a room with a real bad smell in the bathroom. There are no facilities matching the official description and consequently the price is outrageous compared to the quality you get. The staff is polite, but inactive and sleeping. Good intentions but no cigar!! The location is OK and not disturbed by traffic noise like many other hotels in Rome. But if you want to stay at this hotel, negotiate a price discount to € 125 - € 140 max.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is hugely overpriced. Rooms are not 4star but 2.”
Reviews.Author: MMB018
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rip-off. It pretends to be quirky and chic but the rooms are very shabby and the service is unreliable. This hotel charges 4 star prices - 250 euros - but the rooms are 2 star. To be fair the bathroom was quite nice but the bedrooms are drab and depressing. Don't expect a comfortable night's sleep here - the beds are all very old (I asked to see other rooms and the beds - even in their 'deluxe' suite - were all ancient and lumpy). The concierge is not great - he told us the Sistine Chapel was closed when it was open (we took his word for it and missed our opportunity). They have free bikes but we had to wait half an hour while they looked for the key to unlock them. Our bags were put in the wrong room. Quite good breakfast. If this hotel charged about 150 euros it would be okay but at present prices, the experience of this hotel is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: furryfaceEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Locarno, the hotel is very nice, elegant with extremely helpful staff & a good breakfast. The situation is excellent with easy & quick access to all the sights in Rome. Unfortunately our room, 501, in the Annexe, overlooks the open dining/drinking area and this can be very noisy, with, on one night, loud music until the early hours. I would recommend the hotel but avoid this room!

Reviews.Title: “Room was across the street in a dark depressing dungeon, no satellite tv or internet either”
Reviews.Author: jonnyhammond
Reviews.Content: Our room was across the street in a residential block of apartments . No view at all , dark, depressing but it did have a small kitchen in it which came in handy to cook because Rome is so expensive to eat out. £6/9 a pint . Although Hotel looks lovely across the street, great staff but cold bacon and scrambled egg aint really our thing. Although its location is fantastic just around the corner from Trevi fountain, spanish steps and the piazza de popolo and a metro station which takes you everywhere you need to get too. 1st time in Rome and will definately go back but would like a better room next time. For £150 a night I feel not just robbed but violalated. Humans right issue ? lol. But saying that we had a fantastic time in such a beatiful city with so much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Piazza del Popolo”
Reviews.Author: Shuttermom8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Locarno is a funky place with old world charm and excellent service. We were put in the 5th floor suite -- with three bedrooms, two bathrooms, dining room and kitchenette -- for the same price as a regular room. It had a dated elegance, with high celings and antique furniture, but I would describe it as no-frills. The bathrooms were from the 30s or 40s (crazy blue and green tile), but perfectly usable. There was traffic noise from the street below, but that can't be helped in Rome.
