We really liked the outdoor courtyard restaurant at the hotel, which was a great gathering place for hotel guests and locals too. We ordered light fare (salads) but it was delicious. They put out a beatiful spread in the downstairs dining area for breakfast in the morning, with a nice selection of fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, yogurt, and granola.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie29
Reviews.Content: Tough the lobby and bar, with a distinct British feel to them are okay, the general impression was one of old and musty, even though the room was clean. Staff weren't very friendly. An average hotel that happens to be very well located.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: dmcusimano
Reviews.Content: Lobby and bar area were very nice and the view from the rooftop sitting area was a great feature. Rooms were clean and fairly spacious. We had to switch rooms the first night because our AC was not working and was making very loud noises. The rooms were not the most updated- decor was somewhat worn. Overall it was fine for our purposes, but I am sure there are nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: eva_61Eva_61
Reviews.Content: We had such a horrendous experience at this hotel. We were there in August 2009 for four nights and I would NEVER go back. First of all, the air conditioning in the rooms barely works, so we barely slept through the nights (Rome is HOT). Our room was GROSS....it was smelly and always felt wet. I tried handwashing some of my clothes but they never got dry because of how gross the room was! When we went to the reception to complain, the man working at the desk did not speak one word of English...literally...no English whatsoever. I spoke to the manager about the non-English speaking receptionist and he says to me "well Mam, do YOU speak Italian?...No? Then don't complain!" Horrible. Then he offered us an upgrade to a deluxe room for an extra 50 euros per night (i.e. regular price for a deluxe room that happened to be vacant). After fighting with him, he finally switched us into another room, which was just as gross and hot (although he tried charging us an extra 30 euros per night for a 2nd bed in the room....after reminding him that I initially requested 2 beds, he laid that one to rest). We spoke to a few other people staying there and they had very similar experiences with their air conditioner and the management. On the whole, do NOT go to this hotel. It's a shame because the actual building is so beautiful and unique looking with its 1920 vintage look...unfortunately, this hotel caused us nothing but headaches.

Reviews.Title: “decent choice”
Reviews.Author: argentinagavat
Reviews.Content: Serving normal breakfast (which included eggs and ham) which you could have on a beautiful terrace. Of course, definatelly not a four star hotel for who is counting the stars. Close to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great location-value for money”
Reviews.Author: iioann
Reviews.Content: This was a very good stay. The hotel location is excellent, actually near everything. The room we were given was small but clean and tidy. The service was very good and the breakfast in the small, cosy yard, well made. We will visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for the rate.”
Reviews.Author: travelmax_9
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on the internet and value and location was important to me. I needed to be near all the important monuments as we planned to walk all day. This worked out perfect. litterally a few meters from Popolo square. Yodit in the front desk was kind. she printed and faxed something for me all the way back to the USA. Breakfast had good service ( in italian standards. not us ) great espressos on demand . definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Our Bathrooms Didn't Work”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldFresser
Reviews.Content: We were a family group, who stayed in a top floor suite - looked great on arrival (except for the one closet in the entry way and no place to put clothes in the 3 bedrooms. Still the price was right, until we found the toilet didn't work in one of the bathrooms, and the shower drains overflowed in the other 2 (for the whole 4 nights we stayed). Oh, and the whole suite smelled like the sewer problem that it had. They tried to help us out by letting us use a bathroom across the street in the annex - on the 5th floor with the elevator that only went to 4! And they did wind up giving us a discount. But still, I would rather have been somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there!!”
Reviews.Author: DoktorL
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Locarno for a weekend trip. The trip was to celebrate that me and my husband now had received our PhD´s. We really wanted Locarno because of it´s art dëco style. The room was booked well in advance, we confirmed the booking twice in writing, the last time the day before our arrival, just to make sure. We also booked the hotels taxi service from the airport. So we had arranged to be off duty, our parent to babysit, expensive tickets- and when we arrive at the hotel- there was no room for us. Can you imagine?!! We were referred to a truly boring place - with absolutely no chance to select another hotel. The most upsetting part is though yet to come. The new hotel "Residenza Apartment" told us this happens often. Residenza apartment then told us we would not be paying them, but Locarno would charge us for what a room would cost at Locarno, they would then pay Residenza. We refused this, just to find out that a room at Residenza cost 100euro less per night! So it seems Locarno has a special business here, and why not, they earn 100 euro per night for every overbooking they make. I also think it is a shame that books like Hip Hotels and First Class travel guide recommend a hotel like this. It is of anything A Highly Unprofessional Hotel. Dr Linda Block, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “A special occasion spoilt by the hotel staff's complete lack of interest in our concerns”
Reviews.Author: Lavataco
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to a trip to Rome for our anniversary. Hotel Locarno was centrally located and a good stepping off point for touring the city. He had read some good reviews and decided that Suite 605 would be a special treat at €450 per night. We understood that the Locarno was a four star hotel and we were staying in one of the best rooms. Sadly the hotel and the staff fell short of our expectations and tarnished what we had hoped would be a memorable trip. We fell impotent to get a satisfactory solution. What was most frustrating was that every time we raised an issue, staff either ignored us or pretended they would do something and then just forget or choose not to deal with it. All our efforts to speak to the manager were thwarted – she was always out and when staff promised she would be around to talk to she managed to be absent yet again. We never got a face to face talk with the manager during our few days. We ended up leaving a note for her asking her to contact us in the UK. Of course, she didn’t and only finally responded when I had to resort to sending her another email outlining our concerns. Specific Complaints Included BATHROOM. The shower curtain in the bathroom was about a foot too short for the bath. Each time we showered, the water came out below the curtain, flooding the floor and making it not only messy, but more importantly dangerous. The manager tried to tell us that a long curtain would “ruin the whole Art-Deco effect” of the bathroom. The toiletries were meagre – just a liquid soap and no hair conditioner or body lotion. There were no bathrobes and the towels were thin - again not up to four star quality. BEDROOM. Both the mattress and the pillows were too hard to sleep comfortably and despite commenting to the staff on a couple of occasions, we did not get the impression that they were likely to do anything or even cared. Staff told us that the beds were new and would get softer in time – not time enough for our visit! It seems to me that if there's one thing a good hotel should provide then it is a comfortable bed! The air conditioning only worked on one speed and thewas not powerful enough to cool the room at night while the top of the wardrobe was thick with dust. All inexcusable! We ended our trip feeling tired and irritable through lack of sleep. BREAKFAST. Again, the breakfast was mediocre considering this is supposed to be a four star hotel. A few rolls and some tasteless coffee with no visible staff on hand. I have stayed in much better B&B’s at a fraction of the cost. In my opinion, Locarno is resting on its laurels and relying on its Art Deco appearance and maybe a reputation from a bygone era.

Reviews.Title: “True romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WyseARK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Locarno and really loved it. True, the room was small and there are a few blips - you can't reach the loo roll from the loo and the shaving socket was located behind the door so no chance of reaching the mirror. I would like to think the rather rickety lift had been serviced recently but being Italy, who knows. It was an experience However, all this was mitigated by the extremely friendly and helpful staff and beautiful fittings. We loved borrowing the bikes to cycle round Villa Borghese and the location was perfect, near enough to many of the main sights but down a quiet side street. There are a few top restaurants nearby also a couple of pretty decent tavernas for a simple pizza or pasta. I thought the room price a little high, but having paid Rome prices for food and drinks for a few days, came round to thinking it fairly reasonable. I gather a refurbishment is to commence shortly which may tidy up a few corners.

Reviews.Title: “Would have loved to stay at the Locarno...”
Reviews.Author: Plucky17
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest and say I have not stayed at the Hotel Locarno...but not because I didn't try. I booked a reservation with the hotel 3 weeks prior to my vacation in Italy. Upon checking in I was informed that the hotel was overbooked and that there was not a room available for my fiance' and me. Although I was exhausted from several hours of travel that day, I smiled at the woman at the front desk and told her I understood, that sometimes these things just happen. She informed me that they had booked us at a comparable hotel, located just down the street. I thanked her and waited for the offer of a taxi to our new hotel. It never came...and the new hotel was not down the street, it was a few miles away, and up the Spanish Steps - not too convenient when you have 2 heavy bags. If you choose to stay at this hotel I would strongly recommend confirming your reservation several times.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattersons2820
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Locarno and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The best thing is the location; we were within walking distance to everything - from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Piazza del Poppolo. Everything you needed was close. The room is small, but then in my experience, most European hotel rooms are...so no surprises there. They were tastefully decorated with antiques and the housekeeping staff was very friendly (and English speaking). The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We would stay at the Hotel Locarno again if/when we get to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good position downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: ITALIAN_TRAVELLERS08
Reviews.Content: Pretty Hotel downtown Rome, close to Piazza del Popolo, 10 mns walk from Piazza di Spagna. Ask for room in the central block (possibly not in the dependance opposite the street). Bikes available to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: CanadaManitoba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in September and found it to be a good hotel. Staff were helpful to varying degrees, though friendly. Location was great - close to sights, as well as smaller stores, trattories, etc. I'm uncertain about the traveller who found the elevator was never working in September. When I was there in the third week of September, the elevator worked well! I did notice that a number of people tried to operate it and when it didn't seem to be responding, simply walked away, not knowing that one had to manually open the elevator cage door. I've concluded over time that North America has the most physical space and money and can, therefore, build large hotels with large rooms and large amenitites. As a result, you can find numerous wonderful hotels in Europe and other areas, but they will very likely not be as large as they are in North America. Adopt this understanding and you won't go wrong or be so disappointed. In North America, for example, this hotel would rate a 3/5, but in Europe, it is definately a 4/5. Worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “great location .. moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoomendoscopist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Locarno for 2 nights on September 2008. The hotel has a great location near via del Corso and piazza del Poppolo...for someone who has never been in Rome and would love to visit the historic centre this is very important The rooms are clean but very old fashioned...our room had a tiny tv and it was looking more like a house room converted to a hotel room.. breakfast was moderate...the staff was really bored...the food was not replaced... Oh and the elevator was rarely working so most of the times we had to go up on foot... hotels in Italy are expensive compared with other European countries abd especially those near the centre of room but the 250 euros per night in that room was not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Diptych
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that trades heavily on a retro, art nouveau appeal and on its proximity to Piazza del Popolo and the shopping streets of Via del Corso and Via Condotti. To my untrained eyes the art-nouveau heritage is limited to some idiosyncratically shaped windows, a gloomily atmospheric bar and the world's oldest lift cage. The rooms themselves are relatively small and rather charmless as is the breakfast room if al fresco breakfasting is not a possibility. Bar staff and the front desk team are friendly and helpful and the room rates are acceptably modest for such a great location. However, it is this location that is the hotel's greatest strength. Since my last visit the hotel has acquired an adjacent building so doubling the number of rooms giving access to this most glorious corner of Rome. The Borghese Gardens are no more than a stone's throw away; The Tiber itself is at the end of the street; Caravaggio's work in Santa Maria del Popolo is no more than a five minute walk away. We will certainly keep returning to The Locarno and enjoying the access it gives us to all these riches - without diminishing our own significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad surprise !”
Reviews.Author: voyageur010
Reviews.Content: Double check in advance if hot water is availalble just in case they forget to let you know...

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience at Hotel Locarno”
Reviews.Author: janice_1974
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a spectacular 3 night stay at Hotel Locarno in Rome. Our room was spotless and comfortable, which is exactly what you need after a busy day walking around the city. Included in the price is a very filling buffet breakfast (served in the courtyard) and they also have an excellent lunch menu which is very good value for money. We had some problems with our lost luggage and the staff at reception was very quick to help us with our problem. They also gave us lots of information about local restaurants and city tours...without this help we definitely would have been very lost! We chose this charming hotel for its individuallity and we appreciated that we were treated like individuals. 10/10 for Hotel Locarno...we hope to return some time soon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: thaisajs
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for three nights and I can honestly say that the property leaves a lot to be desired. I've stayed at the Hotel Locarno twice in the past five years and generally had a good stay. The hotel itself is beautiful, if a little worn, but the rooftop terrace and the courtyard are lovely. The breakfast is generous and the location couldn't be better for exploring Rome or shopping. But the property seems to be in decline, despite all of the write-ups it keeps getting in the travel magazines. The elevator in the older building seems scarier than its been in the past. Could be because the wood floor appears to be breaking up and there are definitely soft spots in it. During our stay, the air conditioning didn't work. We had to open the window of our first-floor room at night to get a breeze, even though that also let in a lot of noise from the street below. We were offered no compensation or even an apology from the mostly female front desk staff, who were collectively a surly bunch. One morning, when turning my key in and asking about a taxi, one of the women at the front desk said abruptly that she couldn't understand me, turned on her heel and stalked off. The other lady at the desk looked somewhat apologetic and told me that "You're accent is hard." I'm from Indiana. A Midwestern accent is hard? Moving on...avoid Room 113 whatever you do. The bathroom smells terrible. We didn't want to investigate too closely, but the problem appears to be that there's absolutely no ventilation in the room. I think there's some sort of mold issue. Finally, if you're tired and think to yourself, "I'll just go grab a bite to eat at one of the restaurants across the street," be wary. We ate at the restaurant down the street (not the one directly across from the restaurant) and when we got our bill, the waiter short-changed us by 10 euros. I didn't notice it until later, but my companion thinks that he did it on purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chianti_girl24
Reviews.Content: You can walk to Vatican City and most historical attractions from this hotel. We got to see a giant tour bus try to make the turn and about 6 guys jumped out to move a car out of the way. Yes...they lifted the car OUT of the way of the bus. What a fun sight! Very comfortable, great views and great location. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Go with the New Annex”
Reviews.Author: SunFlight
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip alone since having a child, in celebration of our tenth anniversary here. Locarno was a lovely hotel, but we did complain about our room. Our first room was nice, a deluxe room - I think we paid top price for it. But there was a lingering smell from the toilet that I couldn't get past, and we also felt that the room wasn't as luxe as had been made out. So I got up the nerve after a few days and somewhat apologetically complained. They were very nice about it, and I think a day later when available, they moved us into the new annex. Wow! We got a huge room with giant windows and a great bathroom. The courtyard was wonderful, romantic and inviting. The roof deck has very nice views. It seemed rather neglected when we were there, and we were the only people who used it. But that made it even better. We loved the (tiny!) bikes and felt like shriners cruising all over Rome on them. Overall the staff was nice and helpful, and the location and decor were great. We would very likely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Roman holiday at Hotel Locarno”
Reviews.Author: SMH15
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 wonderful days at the Hotel Locarno at the end of April 2008. It was recommended to me by a friend and loved the old Italian charm and charisma. It is located in a quiet street in the centre of Rome and although all the modern facilities were there (safe, television, mini-bar, hairdryer, telephone, internet access etc), I loved the traditional feel of it; thick curtains, wooden floors, antique furniture, and the bed was extremely comfortable. I understand that all rooms are different but that what makes it great. The staff at reception were very helpful and helped me to find my way around Rome and even made some excellent recommendations for dining and shopping. It’s rare these days to be welcomed with a genuine smile and they certainly managed that at Hotel Locarno. There was a buffet style breakfast, good variety and quality and most important for me, excellent coffee. I am already planning my next visit to Rome and Hotel Locarno.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian031
Reviews.Content: I have just come home from Rome and four nights at the Hotel Locarno. The only good thing was its location and the breakfast. I found the hotel terribly shabby and rundown .The rooms (I saw 2) were dark and tiny with small, short and hard beds. The closet was so small that the hangers didn't fit and the clothes kept falling of. The lighting was very poor, we had to use a torch to read in bed! There The staff at the reception desk was not very helpful and very patronizing. There was nothing chic about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Locarno - Elegant Old World Experience”
Reviews.Author: btallen
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Locarno for years. It's right off the Piazza del Populo, easy walking to the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, good restaurants - it's a very lovely neighborhood, upper crust Italian neighborhood. Walking into the lobby is like stepping back into the 1920s, old fashioned charm and perfect appointments. The decor is Old Europe but the amenities are very nice indeed. Everytime we have stayed there we have enjoyed a huge bathroom and nice big bedroom. The bar, with a roaring fireplace, is perfect during the winter and fall. The hotel is owned by a mother and daughter team. Great history - it was a haunt for Italian movie stars, directors, and producers from the 20s to today. We love it - it's not the Hassler but if you want an authentic upper crust Italian experience, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Locarno”
Reviews.Author: ncphoto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno is a wonderful blend of old world charm and new world amenities. Excellent location, helpful staff and delicious food (try the smoked salmon with pink peppercorns) make for a pleasant and comfortable stay. Be sure to check out the roof top terrace. My biggest complaint is the elevator. May be a problem for handicapped or disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel Locarno”
Reviews.Author: Markheathcote
Reviews.Content: Simple and stylish with helpful staff giving good service.

Reviews.Title: “An relaxing week at the Locarno”
Reviews.Author: aljojiro
Reviews.Content: The Locarno is is a charming hotel, tucked away in a side street close to the Piazza del Popolo in the Centro Storico. With a wonderful air of faded elegence, the upper floors are serviced by one of those extraordinary cage lifts, just hanging on for dear life - a grand old lady! Downstairs the reception, bar (and a barman who knows how shake cocktails), lounge and courtyard were just so: understated deco style furnishings, newspapers on sticks and always some jazz playing in the background - even our two teenage boys thought the whole set up totally cool... and if you like your breakfast or evening aperitif on a roof terrace 6 floors above the hustle and bustle of renaissance Rome, this one can't be beat. We'll certainly stay there next time. John & Alison Shepherd - Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Locarno the Great”
Reviews.Author: achilles1200BC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno is a beautiful hotel located in the centre of Rome. Its bar, with Art Deco decor, is very comfortable with excellent food and drink. The rooms are pleasant and stylishly furnished. The breakfast is generous with both food and the hours served (7 - 11). The staff are all friendly and helpful. While the prices for the rooms are a little steep, I happily recommend the hotel for a business or family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Russian Roulette for Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter741
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews that warned the rooms were vasty different in size and quality, as all are unique. But I was not prepared for the cramp, dark, small room we got when we paid for a Deluxe Room. We consoled ourself with the fact that it was a cute, quirky hotel with historical charm. Until we had to face the apalling service at front desk. Staff were unsmiling, surly and patronizing. They also offered some of the worst local travel advise, telling us we should take a private car to Naples for 300 euros when we found out later that the eurostar terminal was only 5 minutes away by cab and the train tickets only cost us 28 euro each! The journey by car and eurostar was approx the same length of time, except we would have felt utterly ripped off had we heeded the advice given by Locarno. I chose Hotel Locarno because they had been featured in Hip Hotels, so I would like to caution any one booking this hotel under the notion that it could be considered hip in any sense. The hotel was filled with retirees (mostly American), and we were the only travelers under the age of 50. We popped out to Capri for an overnight trip, and on our pre-booked return to Locarno, were upgraded to a suite in the other block. This proved to be a far more pleasant room. High ceilings, good size, cute orange drapes, quaint claw foot bathtub. It was much more pleasant, hence booking a room at Locarno is really like playing Russian Roulette. We paid 320 euro per night, there are far better hotels for that value out there. Not hip at all. Only thing we liked - the location near Piazza del Popolo and the 10 min walking distance to Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ebnyc13
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with quaint Roman charm. Close to everything, great breakfast, wonderful staff. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: ahphila
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Locarno one night, then went to Umbria for a week, then returned for a second night. The first night our room was spartan at best, but all the things that mattered were excellent: the room was sparkling clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was plenty of hot water in the shower. Our second night's stay cost 60 euro more, and on top of that we were told we were being upgraded. I'll say! Our room that night was like a palace - ornate ceilings, marble bath, a balcony, oriental rugs... The breakfast buffet is very good and you can eat in a lovely garden courtyard. The staff was charming and helpful. The location of the hotel is top-notch, and the restaurant just down the street was excellent. The clientele is an interesting mix of Italians, Americans, Germans and Frenchmen. The staff speaks excellent English. I miss Hotel Locarno as I type this!

Reviews.Title: “ok for what it charges”
Reviews.Author: coffeebar
Reviews.Content: came to rome for business and then my partner joined me for the weekend. was told that this is one of the best 3 star hotel in the world and when you look at it that way - it is very dissapointing. hotel locarno has a really good location - right by popolo squere, but rome is so tiny that you can not really get a bad location. the rooms are boutique styled. each one is different, but all have the same baroque theme. some rooms are really lovely and some odd. aircondition is lousy and water pressure in the shower is not strong. the hotel has a small courtyard which is really nice but breakfast is served down in a celler with no windows and is not very comftable to go up and down for more coffee or whatever. the hotel is famous for its cinema intustry guests, but its not the stars you see... no, THEY are staying at hotel de russi or the Hussler. no, at locarno you will watch the industry's professionals, like photographers and so on. what can i tell you, when the weekend came, and it was time for my partner to join, i left hotel locarno,,, it was not the hotel i wanted for us to stay at for a romantic getawys.we moved to hotel Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: islandfielder
Reviews.Content: When I travel for work I stay in 5 stars (usually in Rome De Ruisse) but for private trips like smaller boutique hotels. Have wanted to stay in Locarno since I had drinks in bar one December when visiting a friend AND also read the rave reviews in Hip Hotels. Was surprised on check in to be shown to a very down at heel room (stale smell; small and very grotty aand dark) in the main hotel. When I asked to see others I was shown some rooms in Anahi (their annex across the road). These were brighter and more modern (but some also very dark). We finally chose 422 and its the brightest I saw (plus air conditioning works). I gathered the rooms in Anahi and the Annex on other side of courtyard bar are better. We loved the courtyard bar and found the barmen generally to be helpful. The reception staff however were not that helpful and sometimes bordered on rude. Breakfasts excellent and it is a WONDERFUL location (with some really good restaurants in walking distance including St Ana across the road and the upmarket Dai Bolognese on the corner).

Reviews.Title: “Run the opposite direction.....”
Reviews.Author: ewellis
Reviews.Content: Far from elegant, the Locarno is a dark, dreary hotel desperately in need of renovation. Upon entering the hotel, the visitor is greeted by grimy paint, inadequate lighting, stained carpets and no aparent airconditioning (a big deal in Rome in July). Upstairs hallways are even worse. They appear to have last been painted in the art deco era, and the ceilings in the public halls are a jumble of tangled pipes and wires -- all fully exposed. My teenage children, who are adventuresome international travellers, imagined plots out of horror movies. Our group had three rooms. All were dark; walls were covered in old (don't let them tell you it's fine tapestries) fabric, and there were few lamps. It was simply too dark to read at any time of day. Though guest rooms are theoretically airconditioned, they never cooled below 78 or so. The only high point was a lovely bar tender named Fabrizio, who was required to work in the courtyard bar wearing a black coat and tie in 100 plus degree heat. It made us feel badly just to watch him! Compared to other hotels at this price point, like the dei Borgonona, the Locarno does not stand up well. In fact, it's one of the worst I've stayed in in Europe in decades. I have to wonder if the good folks at Fodors and Eyewitness, who are normally so reliable and who wrote such enticing reviews of the Locarno, have ever actually been there.,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Locarno-read before you book”
Reviews.Author: JB71
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay and checking the mixed reviews on return (sadly, not before!), we can see this is one you love or hate. We're firmly in the later, joining the reviewer that wrote the hotel is 'past its glory' - spot on!. The hotel's using Art Deco and antiques as an excuse to have rooms old, dour and dark and if it weren't for the high price this would definitely be a low budget hotel. The roof terrace, marketed as a plus, was deserted and untidy on a July late afternoon and required you to telephone for attention, and pay an extra 20% on top (it's only 6 floors up with no view!!). Service was largely indifferent, a contrast to our stay in Venice (go there instead!). Americans writing in with good reviews need to know this is not European quality or 'character' simply because they have an old lift and fabric wallpaper - it's poor, poor, poor. For this money you would get a much higher quality and a better service in London, (or Venice). V.disappointed. Wish we'd gone elsewhere (and read the reviews here first!)..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisanthony
Reviews.Content: This really nice hotel with some improvements coulkd be an upscale hotel. It needs to instal showers rather then just bathtubs. Otherwise nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Locarno is a must!”
Reviews.Author: sjukick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Locarno is beautiful. Spacious rooms and bathrooms. Well worth the money! Great location, amazing staff and swanky atmosphere. A definite must for those not wanting to go 5 star in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Britaly6
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome many times, third time at the Locarno and this time it was a charm. The hotel staff is excellent, breakfast was a delight, room was charming. We have always loved this hotel and it has been upgraded and improved without losing any of it's charm. The staff, special thanks to Khaled, and the location are terrific. Thanks again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Locarno”
Reviews.Author: jknyart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Locarno for three nights in May 2007; it was all that we had hoped for. Location is terrific (right near Piazza del Poppolo); the hotel is quite elegant in an understated way; the staff couldn't be more helpful; best italian hotel breakfast we've ever had. We were staying in a "superior" room- well decorated with a lovely bathroom. Public areas are lovely; has a neat bar, lots of cosy areas to sit, and a patio that can be quite sybaritic in the late afternoon for drinks (you can also have breakfast there if you wish).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, memorable stay in Rome ..”
Reviews.Author: rh8100
Reviews.Content: March 11, 2006 We stayed four nights at the Hotel Locarno in February 2007 and enjoyed it very much. The location is splendid, the staff very friendly. The hotel's art deco style is lovely, although the room we had was a bit dark. In addition, the white fridge in an art deco furnished room is a complete misfit. The bathroom is well equipped, but a few additional items (e.g. magnifying mirror) that won't cost very must would be welcome. The garden linking the two houses that form part of the hotel must be lovely in summer - it was even nice in February. Overall, our experience was very good and when we come back to Rome, we will stay again at the Locarno.

Reviews.Title: “expected much more”
Reviews.Author: eliakou
Reviews.Content: We went to hotel locarno for our honeymoon and we expected a much friendlier behaviour from the staff. I mentioned in my contact e-mail that it was our honeymoon and I requested a double bed but instead we got the smallest and darkest room one can imagine and, of course, with twin beds. When I asked for a different room, brighter and with a double bed they werent very happy but they showed me other rooms equally smal but with double bed. My husband didnt like their attitude and didnt want any "favours" so we spent a whole week in a room that didnt even have a chair to sit on!! I guess if it was another occasion none of this would have mattered but the thing is that when you are on your honeymoon you feel special and you expect people to treat you like that, especially when you have spent a lot of money for it! Breakfast was great, the room was clean, the atmosphere dreamy, the staff not very helpful with directions and suggestions abbout places to see, to eat etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Townie-TRIP
Reviews.Content: This was truly for us a great experience. We loved the roof garden, espercially at sunset, enjoying our wine and cheese that we bought near by. Although we never actually had a drink at the bar near the lobby I always wanted to. It looked so welcoming! They were however, very happy to give me extra wine glasses to take to our room for our own wine. The courtyard made the very tasty breakfast even more delicious. We found the staff to be helpful and for the most part, intersted in making your stay comfortable. The regular rooms are small but workable. They at least have an authentic feel about them. I wouldn't think twice about staying there again if we are lucky enough to get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: Redtiles
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year at the Hotel Locarno on our first visit to Rome. The hotel has lovely architectural features including the antique lift. Our room was one of the larger side corner rooms in the main building though still not huge it was comfortable. I missed having a tea tray, being a Brit! Breakfast is served in the underground dining room which has a collection of lovely art deco lamps and an amazing antique coffee machine. There is a good selection of fruit, bread, pastries and hot and cold meat. The location is fantastic. We were able to walk everywhere and for New Year had great views of all the fireworks from the hotel roof where prosecco and New Year delicacies were served at midnight. The staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. I prefer traditional hotels and would definitely recommend this one for comfort, old style, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Miajoshua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary for 4 days. We could only get a deluxe room in the annexe which i thought must be lovely for 310 euros a night. We had room 703 and the whole annexe was disappointing - key didnt work in the main door, ugly common parts, large room but decorated poorly), and the worst was the dressing dressing area which was in between the bedroom and the bathroom - if i was in the dressing area my husband could not get into the bathroom or the bedroom as the doors were obstructing. We were very angry when we found out was that we could not get room service to the annexe due to health and safety! The straw that broke the camels back was when the lift broke in the annexe and we were on the 3rd floor. My husband complained and we were moved to a junior suite in the main building which cost 425 euros per night. What a difference it was being in the main hotel - it was a shame that for 75% of our trip we wer not at all happy. Breakfast was fine, and we had a late night pasta at the hotel late on the first night when we arrived which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: darger
Reviews.Content: Hotel Locarno Rome is an expensive city and the Hotel Locarno is no exception. But for your money they have a superior and most helpful staff. Do not be afraid to use them. As in they can arrange transport for example to the airport or from the airport allowing the poor and helpless traveller to avoid Rome's taxi core who managed to take me for a ride every time I was forced to use them. Better yet the hotel is located within easy walking distance of many famous sights. Fifteen minutes to St Peters or the Pantheon. Five minutes from the subway which is easily mastered. All in all Rome is a wonderful tourist experience and the hotel Locarno is part of that

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Fcast2721
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the hotel. We had a wonderful stay and were delighted with the upgrade to the Venetian Suite! Staff at the front desk was helpful and accomodating. The hotel is in the busy Piazza Popolo area so great for walking after dinner--lots of shops and restaurants in the area. I would return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quiet”
Reviews.Author: cyntia
Reviews.Content: A pretty hotel on a quiet side street. A bus close by went right to the Campidoglio and glam shopping on Via del Corso was a 2 minute walk away. We had two spacious rooms, as we were a family of five. Drinks on the Locarno rooftop terrace, and sunny courtyard breakfasts in the mornings were what visiting Italy is all about. The free bicycles were in need of an overhaul but we had a great time one afternoon riding around the Borghese and the Piazza del Populo. Perfect location, and blessedly quiet at night. Staff was a mixed bag, starting with the desk clerk we called from the car in the thick of Rome traffic, who said she "never drives in Rome" so she couldn't give us directions to the hotel. There was also another clerk who told us we couldn't pay in euros but had to get tickets from a tobacconist to take the bus, which wasn't true. You need exact change but you can drop a euro into the ticket machine on every bus and get a ticket. Perhaps this misinformation was due to a language problem as we don't speak very good Italian. However later when our teenage son became ill from some sort of food poisoning they could not have been nicer or more helpful. He recovered quickly and we had a great week in Rome. Despite the not-quite-perfect staff I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit at Hotel Locarno”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Abroad
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Locarno for four nights last week in a ground floor room of the hotel annex. We found it a charming hotel, but in much need of a stronger focus on service. The room was so charming and comfortable, and the patio and roof terrace perfect for a cocktail before dinner. The location was superb -- in the centre of town but off any major roads so you can get proper rest after a long day (Rome might be the noisiest city we've ever visited). Unfortunately, the service was very very average. The staff were never discourteous, but at the same time never warm or helpful. Reception would only perform the most basic tasks, and not always accurately. Additionally, the breakfast buffet was good but not replenished and quality inconsistent. The bar staff provided the best service as far as I remember, but I would have been drinking at the time. We might book here again. I'm a sucker for charm, and the art deco architecture, styling and room decor had my mother and I hooked. But my husband and father would never have appreciated the average service level.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Locarno”
Reviews.Author: Zigbat
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults plus children 14 and 12) spent three nights at the Locarno 23-26 October. We had 2 superior rooms in the main building, 250 Euros per room. Rooms were comfortable and characterful, not particularly large but very clean. Both rooms had fabric-covered walls and antique furniture. (It may be that rooms in the newer building across the courtyard are larger? Worth asking).The courtyard is extremely pleasant for breakfast and drinks in the evening. Staff were friendly, got taxis quickly, called restaurants for us; also arranged car service to and from airport for 45Euros. We liked the location, walking distance from most sights and relatively quiet for Rome, although traffic noise is inescapable. Other highlights: Gusto for lunch; Il Pagliaccio for dinner; and contexttravel.com for exceptional tour guides.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: swissms.
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be perfectly situated for an event I was attending in Rome. I saw it advertised in a publication and coincidentally it was in the best location for me. The breakfast is one of the best and is offered until 11 am! The rooms are small but at least mine was quiet. The staff is very good and the outdoor patio superb. I saw a well-known celebrity staying in the hotel's annex... might be better than the main building? Their cars for hire are popular with hotel guests and city residents alike I discovered. It is in the Art Deco style with old-fashion lift, and is near the Tiber River, Piazza del Popolo and prime shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 2lilmonkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Locarno for 3 nights at the end of September. The location is nice, within easy walking distance of upscale shopping streets, the Borghese Gallery and Park. The breakfast spread was quite large with plenty of choices, hot and cold. The garden tables are nice and the little roof garden is nice, too. The staff was VERY helpful with maps, directions, restaurant recommendations, and even ran interference for us with Air Alitalia over lost luggage. If flying into/out of Rome, ask them to arrange car transport to/from the aiport - it's cheaper than a taxi. The room's A/C did work, although it wasn't a very cold or efficient A/C unit.

Reviews.Title: “Great character, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great old world charm, with rooms that are clean, modern and very comfortable. It is located just off of the Piazza del Popolo, which everyone should see, and is also very close to the main luxury shopping streets. Just down the street are some excellent restaurants like Dal Bolognese (try the fruit sorbets for dessert, they're served in shells of each fruit). My room was very arty and comfy with black and white wallpaper, a cute chandelier and a very clean washroom. It's also quite close to a subway stop, so it's easy to get around. There's a great little courtyard, where we spent many hours having drinks. Service was fantastic. All in all, a great place to stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a woman travelling alone”
Reviews.Author: tdorismor
Reviews.Content: I was very, very happy here--a donna sola. I stayed in the place across the street--the annex--and it was more private which i liked. Also, Khaled, the manager i believe, was very accomodating to me as my flight got in at 6am and check in is traditionally at 3pm and he let me have the room at 8 am so i could sleep off my jet lag. (super and he is so handsome too!) Free bikes with locks. Beautiful tub and ultra lovely linens. Fridge in room. Great roof garden and you can bring your own bottle of wine up and the bar will give you glasses--taking the old-style elevator replete with glass and iron to the top for a sweet view. Breakfast included--in a bricked garden next to the golden hued, great cornettos. 1920s almost art nouveau bar. location is great--piazza dei popolo. go there--it is a little pricey but worth it. the only problem is that it was hard to call the front desk for information.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: stownsa
Reviews.Content: Could be a great place but ownership needs to invest in some updateing. Great location, great breakfast, cool bar/lounge area but carpets in lobby/stairs well worn (and needed a vacuming), tile and portions of wall in bathroom moldy, AC weak at best. Friends stayed in the annex and seemed to think rooms were better (and cheaper). I might be willing to try annex next time, wife would probably say look elsewhere ("depressing").

Reviews.Title: “Worn out but nice location”
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Locarno is located in a convenient neighborhood. The staff was extremely helpful. We enjoyed the lovely breakfast in the courtyard. The option of using the hotel's bicycles is a plus. However, we were disappointed in our rather shabby room which was a Superior Double. Based on the price of $250, we had higher expectations. The hotel appears to occupy two buildings--our room was directly above the lobby area. I suggest inquiring about the condition of rooms in this catergory in both properties. I would not be opposed to staying at the hotel again, but I think there are better options in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic, Freindly atmosphere and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last stop of my honeymoon, and it was the cream du la cream of our trip. We were upgraded to a deluxe room upon arrival and enjoyed it very much because my wife loves art-deco furnishings. We had our breakfast on the roof terras while enjoying an unforgettable view of the city. The staff is very freindly and hospitable, they did their best in making our stay a memorable one. We will definately return for our anniversary and hopefully get upgraded again !!

Reviews.Title: “You've got to try it yourself!!!”
Reviews.Author: tellyman1978
Reviews.Content: To tell you the truth I was a bit drawn back by a couple of reviews I read on this website, but one of my best friends has already stayed there several times and insisted that I should try it myself. I booked a standard double room, which was the most economical category and I must say that it had all necessaties (private bathroom/shower, air-conditioning, TV, phone, minibar and safe), but since we were staying for 7 nights we required a more spacious room and the next day we upgraded to a Superior double which costs a little extra and had a bathtub as well. The guys at the reception are very friendly and helpful and kept calling the airline until we got our final piece of luggage (lost for 3 days) and since it was our first time in Rome, they made suggestions for attractions, sights and restaurants(they even made reservations when necessary). The bar is very cosy and we enjoyed our drinks in the courtyard and on their wonderful roof-terrace, not to mention the fabulous breakfast buffet that had lots of delicious selections. I decided during our stay to view the various room categories and discovered that each room had its own character (liberty style and art-deco) and realized why movie stars and celebrities choose this hotel in particular (I met a couple of celebrities there myself). I remember reading a negative review about an 'appartment', but it turned out to be a non-smoking deluxe room which is located on the third floor of the refurbished wing and had an entrance around the corner because the hotel did not own the second floor of that building. In conclusion, if you are looking for a hotel in Rome that has a great location, friendly staff, special non-traditional character and affordable rates, Hotel Locarno is definatly the place to be, but don't take my word for it, try it yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a superb location, just returned from a 4 night stay with wife and 2 kids (12 and 15) Easy to get to - 1 hour from Fiumicino airport via train and metro. The metro get you to within a few hundred meters of the hotel on the other side of the lovely Piazza del Popolo Major sites are all within walking distance - Vatican, St Angelo, Pantheon, Forum, Colloseum, etc. Near the Tiber and Borghese gardens for evening strolls/morning runs. Hotel is very quaint, quiet and friendly. Our rooms were on the small side but fine unless you plan to spend a lot of time in room. Clean and well decorated - loved the fabric wallcovering and high ceilings. Small courtyard is ideal for evening drink or breakfast if warm enough Wide breakfast choice, mainly breads, cheeses, meats etc but also some hot food (didn't sample this) and plenty of fruit and pastries etc The only downside was the bar prices (5 EUR per drink) - but this was no more than other bars in the area. Doesn't do evening meals, but loads of places to eat within 5 mins walk Would definately recommend and go again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AllWhoWnderRNotLost
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay at the Hotel Locarno in mid-May. We were in the building across the street from the main building on the 4th floor. The room was nice and had double pane windows to keep out the noise at night. The bed was very firm and we slept great. The main hotel is beautiful, but also very interesting, with their unique elevator (we ate breakfast on the roof top terrace every morning) and the bar (not sure of the era but maybe 20's). The staff was also very helpful and the location great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved it. The Art Deco/Nouveau decor is tastefully done and appealed to us. The rooms were excellent. Very clean and well appointed. The breakfast was good and very varied, with fresh egg and bacon replenished. You could not want for more and we skipped lunch! The staff were unfailingly helpful and courteous. I cannot understand the poor reviews as we rated as one of the best European hotels we have visited with central location and bags of character. Perhaps they are Americans wanting a Holiday Inn?

Reviews.Title: “Not nice at all”
Reviews.Author: joanne7575
Reviews.Content: Deeply disappointing hotel from every angle except location. Rooms not very nice in the annex, terrible beds, terrible bathroom, terrible lighting and no air-conditioning in May. They said it was the law but we stayed in hotels in Tuscany ahead of our visit to Rome and they all had airconditioning. The staff wasn't nice and, when our taxi did not show up to take us to the airport, shrugged it off. It turned out that they forgot to order it but not even one apology. There are lots better places in Rome (Casa Howard for one) and I wish we had stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful with Your Visa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Hotel Locarno for this April, giving my Visa Card details in order to hold the room. I then had to cancel the room and did this by e-mail in January. The hotel subsequently charged my card for a 'No Show' . Despite having sent them a copy of my e-mail, dated and timed, cancelling the room they are refusing to cancel this charge. They are claiming they never received the cancellation and that I must have used the wrong address? The correct address is clearly on the e-mail. It took them a week to respond to my e-mails and phone-calls and now I am having to go through Visa to have the charge refunded. I have never experienced such terrible customer service, especially considering something like Visa where you need to feel secure in giving your Visa details in teh first place. I have read several complaints in relation to customer service for this hotel and would advise against staying in it. For an excellent hotel experience I owuld recommend the Hassler Hotel or their affiliated hotel, the International Wine Academy.

Reviews.Title: “The location sells this place.................”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two nights - 19th to 21st November 2005 This hotel was recommended by friends but I was still very wary after reading the reviews - at the time of writing this someone who stayed there at the same time had a bad experience. We booked a superior double at 220 euros (incl breakfast which is served to 11 - get down earlier than 10 to get full variety) per night and were on the 3rd floor of the main building. Is probably a little overpriced but it all comes back to the location..........read on. Our friends had told us what to expect so we were prewarned - art deco, dark and a little worn but in a fantastic and very peaceful location - only the odd begger and no handbag men so it felt safe coming out and walking home at night. After walking around the other areas during the day (they must be awful at night) I am very glad we were able to escape to the peace and tranquility of the Locarno area. More on the location: two minutes from the Piazza di Popolo; lots of great restaurants (try Angelina - in alley way off Via Del Corso; Gusto - huge modern place can't miss it). We walked around all day Sunday and made it down to the Colluseum - direct would take around 40 minutes but we stopped at all the bits en route, Trevi & Spanish Steps (10-15 minutes) etc. and came back via the Piazza Navano - beware of pick pockets and street sellers when in the really touristy areas, they are everywhere. The Vatican is 20 minutes walk but we saved our feet the next day by taking a taxi which the lovely ladies on reception called for us - estimated 10-15 Euros but was only 7 on the meter ! IF you are looking for modern, big and busy then this is not for you. IF you want a great location, a clean and comfortable bed (our bathroom was lovely), a log fire in a very quiet bar and what I thought was good and friendly service then I can recommend the Locarno. Also recommend the car transfer service (fixed price: 45 Euros from airport and 35 Euros return - extra 10 allows for delay and we were!) I took photos but cannot load them at this time.

Reviews.Title: “They ripped us off - Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE booked 2 deleuxe rooms for two nights. It cost us 1240 EUROS - they cheated us and put us in the new annex in the worst rooms I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world - we complained but they said the hotel was full and could not be moved - I tried to complain at the end but we had to pay because they kept our passports. The Manager is making so much money she would not speak to us. If you are considering this HOTEL from HIP HOTELS or the WEBSITE - please think again. BEWARE THE PHOTOS ARE NOT REPRESENTITIVE - and you will notice no other photos ! Contact me if you want for a full explanation - I just dont want anyone else to go through what we have been through - cheated. I wouldnt have minded so much but we booked it 4 months in advance and requsted special rooms because it was the first time in 12 years we had been away without the children - they confirmed everything - but when we got there - STITCHED UP. PLEASE BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the charming Hotal Locarno”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews and location, and I was overall very pleased. The temperature was hot in Rome in August, and the hotel's air conditioning was as icy as we needed it, with controls right in the room. We stayed in Anahi, the annex right across the street, for 5 or so nights, then after a trip to Venice, stayed our last night in the main hotel in a lovely double room. The only negatives were that our room on the 4th floor was absolutely tiny, although wonderfully decorated, the wall around the bathtub was crumbling, and one of the bedside reading lamps had a short in it which tended to short out the whole room. We kept asking for a deluxe room, but were told there were non available during our stay. On the last part of the trip, we requested a deluxe room, and had a large room just off the courtyard in the main building, which i found to be much nicer than the small room we had in Anahi. The breakfast was fantastic, and the decor of the main hotel in particular, with it's charming art deco bar, artwork, courtyard and lounge, is just beautiful. The location is on the very north end of the historic section of Rome, and while the street is a side street, there is quite a lot of traffic while walking, and crossing over into the Piazza Del Popolo. There are restaurants within easy walking distance, although they were quite touristy, and we were often panhandled in the piazza and at the restaurants. We preferred to walk further towards Piazza Navona, past the Spanish steps. The walk can get quite long, and often at night on the narrow sidewalks next to much traffic, but there is a taxi stand in the Piazza if you need it. They also arranged for a car from and to the airport, and we loved the driver so had him take us to an event in Ostia we attended. Overall, I would absolutely return there, although I admit to wanting to stay closer to Via Veneto next visit. Bottom line, try for a double deluxe if possible, ask to view the room first, use their airport car service, and for sure eat breakfast there , as well as have a drink in the lovely bar. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful, and any issues were addressed promptly. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Excessive Street Noise”
Reviews.Author: Upgrade
Reviews.Content: We had a very spacious (but extremely dark & dingy) room in the annex @ 310 Euros (across a charming courtyard from the main building). The room lighting was too dim to read anything at night! Worse yet, although it was October, the air conditioning was so inadequate we had to keep the windows open at night ... to the tune of loud motorcycles & scooters all night long!! The side street location looked on the map as if it would be quiet, but it apparently is a major traffic shortcut. The breakfast was quite good, and the location is pretty good, too ... just not the street noise. Staff was pleasant and helpful, but we would not stay there again -- it was not the restful, enjoyable experience we had sought.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Louisie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the annex in early October and for 310 euro a night was not impressed. The room while huge was very dinghy, the bed head was appalling, and the lack of tea coffee facilities in room a pain, they also do not have an iron in the whole hotel. Breakfast was a plus, the dining room is lovely and the food was very good and a good selection of hot and cold. We did have a balcony though, and the view of the basillica at the end of the street is charming. I think the rooms need a big update, and the cost is not worth what you get.

Reviews.Title: “For Many Reasons, A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: starkfarm
Reviews.Content: This conveniently located hotel - great for walkers - was charming. Yes, a bit dark, with furniture that was at best adequate, but a terrific staff, more than ample complimentary breakfast, and great services. The staff's recommendation of a restaurant directly across the street resulted in our finding the best place to eat on our two-plus week trip through Italy. And the hotel arranged for a comfortable and reliable limo to take us to FCO for only 35 euros! Every "special" request we made (batteries needed changing in the TV's remote, for example) was met promptly. Best of all, was that our room's shower (in the old part of the building) was as good as any we'd ever experienced in Europe. That, alone, was enough to give this comfortable hotel a strong rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: quiltfan55
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in the Hotel Locarno. Our first impression was one of a dingy, run down, warm, stale aired, past its glory innercity hotel. Our opinion went downhill during our stay. The airconditioning felt like it was merely recirculated air. The bedding was oldfashioned, and not in a good way The elevator was not charming, it was loud, slow, and not always working. The whole hotel was dark and musty. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay in the Apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Locarno at the beginning of May following a recommendation from a friend who had also been there and I thought that the prices for a double room (Euro 190/night) for a centrally located hotel were very reasonable. When we arrived at 3pm, the room was not ready and we were informed that, due to a flood in the hotel, we would be relocated to the appartment and would be given a reduced rate of (Euro 160/night). The apartment is on the top floor of a 5 storey block around the corner from the hotel - it has stunning views of the city, but that is about the only positive thing about it. It is the equivalent of a two star (at most) serviced apartment but the furniture was dirty and the kitchen still had the remnants of the last guests (half eaten nuts and the like). Several things broke when we tried to use it and they did not come and clean the room the following day. We did complain and managed to get relocated to the hotel on the last night. I am glad we did, as we were able to experience the quirky hotel which had been described to us and I have therefore given the hotel a better rating than I otherwise would have done. Breakfast on the terrace is a very pleasant affair. I would probably recommend this hotel, based on how they dealt with our complaint and the fact that the hotel is nice and comfortable inside. Do not, however, let them fob you off with staying in the apartment - I don't think it is worth saving the extra Euro 30/night.

Reviews.Title: “May 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy & Rome and we loved it all. We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Locarno, an art deco hotel which is very charming with a great location, within walking distance to everything. Many places to eat, from upscale restaurants to small trattatorias & pizza places in the streets close to the hotel. The staff are excellent and very accommodating to all your needs. The rooms are very clean, safety deposit box in room, and the breakfast is outstanding, we looked forward to it every day...great cappucino! Nice little coutyard and rooftop garden to enjoy a drink after a long day of walking. We walked to everything from the hotel. Close to metro stop, across the Piazza de Poppolo. You can take the metro to the train station, catch a train to the airport for 9 Euros per person, or the staff will gladly make arrangements for pick at the hotel. We stayed in the Annex our first 5 days in Rome, then went on a trip to Sorrento and came back to Rome for 2 nights. Although there was a problem with an overbooking the first night, the hotel staff were superb in quickly finding us accommodation at another hotel which was also very nice...but we were happy to come back to Locarno the 2nd night at which time they had upgraded our room to a suite! If we visit Rome again, we will most definetely stay at Hotel Locarno with its outstanding customer service by all staff members. fdavis@rogers.com Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahwahlady
Reviews.Content: My family and I (7 of us) booked the Locarno based on a recommendation as well as the reviews of Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The location was convenient, close to the Piazza del Popolo and easy walking to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Vatican. However, if you want to get to the Piazza Navona, it would be a really long walk (a short cab ride). We took a bus to the Colesseum. The thing that swayed us in making a decision, all other things being about equal, was that all reviews stated what a great breakfast was served, and they were right. The breakfast (especially for a moderate hotel in Rome) was FANTASTIC -- from eggs, meats and cheeses to a large variety of cereals and fruits to an assortment of pastries and breads, etc. - You name it, they had it. It was served in a garden-like courtyard which was very pretty. Considering that the 7 of us would have had to pay for a substantial breakfast to give us a good start for the day's touring, it was really a bargain. We stayed in the Locarno annex just across the street from the main hotel (called the Anahi) and the rooms were more than satisfactory - not cramped at all and very clean. The air conditioning was excellent - no problems at all. A double was 150 euros. We had espresso one evening on the roof top of the main hotel in the evening, which was lovely. The staff speaks English and were helpful in getting us cabs, etc. The best pizza in Italy was just down the street from the annex as you walk toward the Piazza Popolo. We went on to the south of Italy from Rome but were spoiled for all future pizzas we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JF&PM
Reviews.Content: The Locarno is a lovely hotel in a great location, within easy walking distance of all of the major sites. We stayed 5 nights in total in the new annex across the courtyard. The rooms were a little dark, but were spacious, comfortable and quiet. The staff were very pleasant and helpful which, from our perspective, often makes or breaks a hotel. The breakfast in the courtyard was very nice. We would not hesitate to stay at the Locarno again.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast/location EVER”
Reviews.Author: yimicat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the annexe hotel (Anahi)--it was like having our own little apartment in Roma. The rooms aren't super luxurious, but nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and I found the location to be ideal. I stayed in eight different hotels on my visit to Europe and the Locarno's breakfast was at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Single female traveler - Locarno was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LiliBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the "Annex" - the ANAHI. It's a little hotel across the street (the entrance seems more like a residence) - a tiny street. Apparently the Locarno acquired the ANAHI and it is now part of the Locarno but they still call it by it's old name. I'm explaining this because it was difficult to understand the situation when I was booking the room. There is no smoking allowed in the Annex, which is fantastic. It has five floors, and the fifth has only one room - mine! Had my own staircase, even, and there was a locked door at the bottom of it as well as a locked door for my room. I felt very, very safe (and I'm a safety stickler). I had a private bath in my room, and there was a little rooftop terrace outside the corridor - I was the only one up there. The room was much larger than your typical European room, and it was very clean. The icing on the cake here is that they charge less for rooms in the Annex because they don't provide room service there. Who wants to eat room service in Italy?!? (Btw, the included breakfast is very good). And there's no smoking! 105e/night. It was great. There were a few glitches (my TV remote didn't work, had a little difficulty with the shower one day), but for the most part it was great, and I loved the staff. (Oh, and the shower head was like one you see in a spa - like a rainfall!) I'll stay there again when I get to return to Rome, and I'll request my room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: di8380
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Our room was in the new building overlooking the courtyard. The room was clean, good sized bathroom with tub/shower. Breakfast was excellent. Location was convenient for walking everywhere and close to subway. We'll stay here again our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms could be improved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locarno over the May bank holiday weekend. The location is first-rate- close to everything- and I mean everything- even the Vatican is a 15 min walk away. The breakfast is good- best of all it is served in the leafy courtyard which is a delight to sit in at all times of the day. Now for the negatives- we arrived to be told that our €150 room in the new annexe had been "flooded" due to a faulty pipe and we could take our pick of a new hotel across the river or a small room for the 1st night and a suite for the 2nd night. we were shocked when we saw the small room- it was no bigger than a closet and was most certainly not worth the €100 rack rate they claimed- more like a €30 hostel room. After much insistence by my husband (we said the very least the hotel could have done was infomed us via telephone since the "flooding" was claimed to have happened the previous day) the girl at the reception made a few calls and informed us that she would be putting us up in a room in the old building and would have to send some other people to another hotel! room was smallish but okay. Did not see any senior management at the hotel - if indeed there had been flooding surely owner/mgr etc could have been present to explain situation rather than have desk clerk fob us off? rest of stay was good- staff helpful on the whole. Do recommend but be wary of efforts to change booking/switch rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: amurphy777
Reviews.Content: we loved everything about this hotel and hope to return one day. Best breakfast in Rome...lovely courtyard and rooftop...I can't imagine staying in any other hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “What a breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned to Ireland from a four-night stay at Hotel Locarno and we couldn't say a bad thing about it. Our rooms were in the original hotel - they were very spacious with good-sized bathrooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is central to all major attractions. As for the breakfast, it was just scrumptious!! All in all, an excellent hotel and would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading a variety of mixed reviews on this hotel I was somewhat unsure of what two expect. However, having just returned from a two night stay I can thouroughly recommend it. While 200 Euros a night is not cheap for a three star hotel which is not overly luxurious the charming atmosphere, great location and helpful staff make it money well spent. My room was comfortable, breakfast was impressive and the bar a great place to enjoy a pre dinner drink or night cap. I left with a feeling of affection for this welcoming, warm and unique hotel and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Locarno”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan. 18th. for three nights. Lovely staff, good breakfast. A very reasonable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Locarno”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Locarno from December 27th 2004 to January 2nd 2005, and I would recommend the hotel unreservedly. Location is great – a quiet street off the busy Piazza del Popolo, and an easy walk to just about everywhere, from the chic shopping on Via Barbuino to the unexpected tranquillity of the Borghese Park, to the tourist bustle of Piazza Navona. We really liked the art deco bar and public areas, where fires were lit all day every day. Breakfast was served in the rather gloomy basement during our stay, but it was nonetheless the best breakfast buffet we've come across in Italy (ie, organic cheeses, etc). The rooms are recently decorated with pretty wallpaper and old dark furniture, very attractive and comfortable. Our bathroom was great – big, with a good shower and bath. Staff were friendly and helpful (and booking a car to and from the airport is a great idea.) Make sure you check out the roof terrace!
